column1: 30,"Aircraft Maintenance Engineer, Apprentice - YVC",Rise Air,"La Ronge, SK",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/aircraft-maintenance-engineer-apprentice-yvc-la-ronge-11--7494091e-c516-4a1f-9899-b1ae7ccbc3c8?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.2&_ga=2.165770169.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
column3: line-height:normal"">Full Time
column4:
line-height:normal"">LaRonge SK


Rise Air is western Canada's largest full-service aviation operation. Based in LaRonge here is your opportunity to work in the fascinating aviation industry for a dynamic company that exceeds customers' expectations, strives for operational excellence, and has a strong employee culture.

Job Purpose

Under the direction of the Base Engineer, this position is responsible for completing the day-to-day maintenance activities on our fleet of fixed-wing aircraft in accordance with Transport Canada approved standards. The aircraft maintenance engineer apprentice will complete all tasks required to obtain their Aircraft Maintenance Engineer License.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Complete each task and associated maintenance documentation in an appropriate, safe, and timely manner.
  • Maintain close communication with senior maintenance personnel to ensure that mandated job processes and methodologies are understood and adhered to.
  • Report any defect that is noted while performing maintenance tasks.
  • Ensure that all components installed on aircraft are pre-approved and properly certified.
  • Accurately account for all completed maintenance tasks by maintaining an up-to-date logbook.
  • Assist in keeping the maintenance office, hangar, and shop areas clean and ensure equipment is appropriately stored/returned after tasks are completed.
  • Attend training courses as approved and required.
column5: background:#ffffff"">Qualifications
column6:
background:#ffffff"">Typically, the knowledge and skills required for this position include a high school diploma or equivalent, and the successful completion of a diploma in Aircraft Maintenance from a Transport Canada-approved educational institution. Knowledge and understanding of Canadian Aviation Regulations and previous experience working in an aviation environment is considered an asset.

Skills, knowledge, and abilities include:

  • Ability to hold and maintain a class 5 valid driver's license.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Sound problem solving, decision-making, analytical thinking, planning, prioritization, and execution skills.
  • Ability to take initiative and ownership of projects and tasks and execute effectively and in a timely manner.

As this is a Safety Sensitive Position, selected candidate(s) must test negative for impairing substances and alcohol prior to employment.

Conair is global leader in aerial firefighting, offering the largest privately-owned fixed-wing fleet of specialty aircraft in the world. Operating in Canada, the US, Europe, Australia and beyond, the organization providesa comprehensive range of aircraft, crew, maintenance, and training to support government agencies fighting wildfires. Our long-standing reputation for providing service excellence makes us an industry leader. And one of our strengths is our team, a group of professionals committed to safety and service.

We currently have an opening for a full-time permanent Aircraft Maintenance Engineer position.

Reporting to Lead Hands, Base Engineers and/or department supervisors, an Aircraft Maintenance

Engineer will work under supervision and with detailed instruction maintaining fleet aircraft. An Aircraft Maintenance Engineer may also be required to go on field assignments as an assistant to the Base Engineer.

In this role your duties will include the following:

  • Assisting with the maintenance of Conair fleet A/C and production projects as assigned

34,Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (CAT 01),Air Canada,"VANCOUVER, BC",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/aircraft-maintenance-engineer-cat-01-vancouver-02--c78f9e1c-8d2b-471d-9e72-2da6cc86967e?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.6&_ga=2.165770169.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

Description

Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.
 
Air Canada is presently looking for dynamic individuals to fill the permanent full-time positions of Aircraft Technicians or Aircraft Maintenance Engineers at our Vancouver Maintenance Centre.
 
The position is located near the Vancouver International Airport. The current salary starts at $31.50/hour, based on experience and according to the Collective Agreement.
 
Aircraft Technicians / Aircraft Maintenance Engineers are responsible for airframe maintenance and should have the following skill sets:
•    Ability to use the correct tools, methods, techniques and equipment required to perform aircraft maintenance.
•    Candidates should be able to read and understand various schematic diagrams for maintenance troubleshooting and be proficient with computers and diagnostic tools.
•    Individuals need to be ""team players"" with excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to maintain a customer focused attitude in a demanding, high stress environment.
Please take 2 minutes to watch the following video with more information about the Aircraft Technician/Aircraft Maintenance Engineer role: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cuwqi8PokME
 

Qualifications

  • Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Required as of October 31st 2021
  • High School diploma.
  • You must have completed a recognized apprenticeship program, and/or have a least 4 years industry related experience.
  • Possession of a Transport Canada AME M2 or M1 license (Mandatory)
  • Possession of valid driver's license (Mandatory)
  • Able to successfully pass the pre-employment qualifying exam, physical and a security check.
  • Be available to work night, evenings and days including weekends and holidays.
  • Night shift is the permanent position for this posting. Possibility to change with seniority.
  • Be available to work night, evenings and days including weekends and holidays.
  • Eligible to work in Canada.
  • Ability to Pass and obtain an airside vehicle operator’s permit (Mandatory)
  • Possession of a restricted radio operators permit (aviation).
  • Ability to pass security clearance and obtain the Restricted area identity card (RAIC). Please refer to Transport Canada site for more details.
  • Employees in this role, conduct safety-critical work and as such, Air Canada medical standards must be met in order to qualify for the role. Candidates will be subject to a medical evaluation, including a drug and alcohol test and are expected to be free of any intoxicating substances.
  • Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibly of the candidates applying for this position.

Assets

  • Endorsements on Air Canada aircraft type.
  • Current security clearance.

Linguistic Requirements

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates. 

Diversity and Inclusion


Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.


As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest

column1: 35,Aircraft Maintenance Engineer - M2,Flying Colours Corp - FCCN,"Peterborough, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/aircraft-maintenance-engineer-m2-peterborough-08--6205fab6-fcfd-4d84-9210-5a30ce0f8bd3?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.7&_ga=2.165770169.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"<section class=""cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA""><table style=""width:100%
column2:
height:1651px"">

Flying Colours Corp is a global leader in all aspects of aircraft completions and maintenance. With facilities in Canada, USA, and Singapore our continued growth and success is driven by our talented workforce that embody our core values: integrity, innovation and flexibility.


Due to continued growth in our businesses, we have a requirement for an AME (M2) to join our Team at our Peterborough, Ontario location.



General Accountability
column3: line-height:16pt"">A licensed AME is responsible for knowledge of piston, turbo prop, jet aircraft and the maintenance applications associated with them. Furthermore, including but not limited to repairs, modifications and inspections on aircraft structures, systems and equipment.
column4:
line-height:115%"">Specific Accountabilities

  • Visually inspect, assess, and assist in repairs and modifications to aircraft structures, systems, and equipment.
  • Remove, install, and functionally test aircraft components.
  • Dismantle and assemble aircraft systems for repair and overhaul.
  • Remove aircraft control systems, check rigging, and re-assemble.
  • Diagnostically troubleshoot aircraft defects and carry out corrective action.
  • Ensure that all maintenance activities are controlled on aircraft that are receiving maintenance within the company's facilities and that technical records are originated and retained with respect to all inspections and maintenance functions.
  • Complete records of work done to sustain an accurate record system.
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret blueprints and written technical instructions.
  • Must perform work in accordance with all Transport Canada guidelines.
  • Performs work in a productive, diligent, careful and safe manner.
  • Complete any special projects or other tasks as required or assigned. May be assigned to other areas of operations, based on business or customer requirements.
  • Works in compliance with all Administrative, Health &
column5:
Safety policies and procedures as per legislative requirements and as outlined in Company policies.
  • Any other job-related duties assigned by department management
column6:
line-height:115%"">Experience and Education Requirements

  • Completion of secondary school is required.
  • Completion of College/CEGEP/vocational/technical training in Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (AME) is required.
  • AME ""M"" Aircraft License (M2)
  • At least 3 years of licensed aircraft maintenance experience is required
  • Experience or endorsements on Citations, Falcons, Gulfstreams, Hawker, Beechcraft, Lear series, Bombardier CL300, CL600-605, CL850, BD700 Global aircraft is particularly desirable.

Skills/Abilities

  • Ability to interpret engineering drawings, wiring diagrams, and work instructions.
  • Good mobility, manual dexterity and physical condition to work in areas within the aircraft where access may be limited.
  • Ability to maintain professional work habits at all times.
  • Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Internet research.
  • Good administration, organization, and planning skills.
  • Able to work both independently and within team environment, where tasks maybe shared or reallocated daily.
  • Must have flexibility to adapt to changing demands and schedules, including needs of the organization.
  • Excellent attention to detail, analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Posses excellent interpersonal and communication skills to maintain effective relationships.
  • Ability to understand and follow direction with minimal supervision.
  • Positive attitude and willingness to learn.

Working Hours

This is a full-time (FT) position where hours will change due to business operational needs and flexibility is required. At present the standard hours of work are 6.30am to 6.30pm on a 4-day-on, 4-day-off rotation


Working Conditions

  • Regular periods during which there is continuous physical effort required, e.g., walking, standing, stooping, climbing, lifting material or equipment, some of which may be heavy or awkward.
  • Exposure to factors such as temperature variations, fumes, moving machinery, humidity, noise, and materials which cause periods of discomfort.
  • Frequent need to give concentrated close attention, with one or two senses at a time, where stimuli are changing.
  • Noticeable pressure from deadlines, production quotas, accuracy or similar demands.
  • Work in confined spaces and elevated heights when required.

Compensation

We offer competitive compensation to qualified and highly motivated candidates. Please note that applicants for these positions must have current status to work in Canada in order to be considered for this opportunity.


While we appreciate all resumes received,we can only contact directly those applicants under consideration for interview.


Flying Colours Corp. is proud to participate in the Legislated Employment Equity Program (LEEP). We welcome applications from all qualified candidates including candidates representing the four designated groups: Women, member of Visible Minorities, Aboriginal Peoples and Persons with Disabilities.

Job Details

column1: 36,"Aircraft Maintenance Engineer - Category ""M"" (Vancouver)",Pacific Coastal Airlines,"Vancouver, BC",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/aircraft-maintenance-engineer-category-m-vancouver-vancouver-02--e6cb05d9-30e8-4315-85e9-bb82e5352e28?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.8&_ga=2.165770169.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
column3: background:#ffffff"">Join our Vancouver team!
column4: line-height:115%
column5:
background:#ffffff"">Pacific Coastal Airlines is looking for a permanent full-time Aircraft Maintenance Engineer Category ""M"".This position is based out of a hangar located near the South Terminal building at the Vancouver International Airport in Richmond.

Aircraft Maintenance Engineer - Category ""M"" role requires adherence to the highest level of safety standards and the ability to follow policies and execute procedures, utilizing skill and knowledge, to identify and prioritize operational problem areas. The successful candidate must ensure proper paperwork is in order and submitted in a timely manner, meaning all certification and recertifications must be recorded prior to releasing aircraft into service. He/she must also stay current on Company Maintenance Control Manuals and other industry-related manuals/material.

Qualifications:

  • Valid Transport Canada AME license - category M1 and M2
  • Experience working on SAAB 340 and Beech 1900 is a strong asset
  • The ability to obtain and maintain a RAIC and an AVOP
  • Ability to travel as required
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to work well in a team environment

WHY PACIFIC COASTAL AIRLINES?

Company Culture: We honour our company motto of People Friendly, People First for both our employees and our passengers. We encourage a positive, caring workplace and put a high value on collaboration, accountability, and loyalty. We are inclusive, respectful, and have a friendly corporate culture.

Compensation: We recognize and value industry experience by offering competitive compensation commensurate with prior experience as well as a company-match Group RRSP to assist with retirement planning.

Health Benefits: We offer a standard benefits package consisting of health, dental, vision, travel medical, life insurance, AD&
column6:
D, short-term disability, long-term disability, an employee and family assistance program, paid sick days, and paid personal emergency days.

Travel Benefits: We offer excellent travel perks within the Pacific Coastal network for employees, their families, and their buddies. Also available to employees and their eligible family members is standby travel on many other airlines across the world. Additionally, employees are eligible for corporate discounts with various hotels and restaurants within the communities we serve as well as steeply discounted cargo shipping within the Pacific Coastal Airlines network.

Employee Programs: We have employee recognition and reward programs, a milestone service recognition program and employee appreciation events throughout the year.

Other Benefits: Tool and boot allowance, up to $500 yearly.
column7: line-height:115%
column8:
background:#ffffff"">Pacific Coastal Airlines is an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to a policy of non-discrimination in all of our employment practices. We welcome and encourage applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of ethnicity, gender, disability or any other identifying characteristic.

column1: 37,Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (AME â€“ M),Longview Aviation Services,"Calgary, AB",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/aircraft-maintenance-engineer-ame-%C3%A2-m-calgary-01--523fdad7-d783-49cf-9963-933d71d9387e?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.9&_ga=2.165770169.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
column2:
margin-bottom:11px"">With a rich heritage and an outstanding portfolio of iconic aircraft, De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. is set to lead the aviation sector of the future.  The De Havilland EAF program (Longview Aviation Services Inc.), established in 2018, is focused on creating an ""Enhanced Aerial Firefighter"".   The program involves taking selected CL-215 aerial firefighting aircraft and combining the proven performance of existing airframe(s) with modern upgrades - All in an effort to create the next generation of the worldâ€™s only purpose-built aerial firefighter and multi-mission amphibious platform, the CL-415 EAF.

Responsibilities:

  • Install, rig and carry out mechanical and structural functions and testing in accordance with the manufacturer's specifications
  • Disassemble, inspect, record discrepancies as well as recommend and record methods of repair
  • Repair and fabricate parts and components
  • Ensure that all applicable airworthiness requirements are met
  • Ensure both accuracy and traceability of parts removed or installed on the Aircraft
  • Follow the policies and procedures laid out in the Company's Transport Canada Approved Maintenance Policy Manual to ensure the Company is in full compliance with the current Canadian Aviation Regulations
  • For those AME's possessing certifying authority, perform and/or certify work performed within the scope of this Aircraft Maintenance Organization
  • Maintain a clean work area, and alert the Supervisor of any safety concerns
  • Perform any other work assigned

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • 2 years experience working on CL 415/215T/215 aircraft and CL 415/215T/215 systems
  • 5 years experience with general aircraft repair, fabrication and installation
  • Valid AME â€œM1â€ or â€œM2â€ Transport Canada License
column3:
M2 is preferred or be eligible to be an apprentice to achieve this license

column1: 38,Aircraft Maintenance Analyst,"Jet Support Services, Inc.",Montreal,https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/aircraft-maintenance-analyst-montr%C3%A9al-10--a3e27d80-f189-4606-8ef8-1ed1edd61c67?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.10&_ga=2.165770169.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"<section class=""cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA"">About JSSI

For more than 30 years, Jet Support Services, Inc. (JSSI), has been the leading independent provider of maintenance support and financial services to the business aviation industry. JSSI is responsible for maintaining in excess of 2,000 business jets, regional jets, and helicopters across the globe and serves customers through an infrastructure of certified technical advisors. JSSI leverages this technical knowledge, experience, buying power, and data to provide support at every stage of the aircraft life cycle
column2: from aircraft acquisition to aircraft teardown and part out.

column1: *Hourly Cost Maintenance Programs to stabilize aircraft maintenance budgets, enhance residual value, and provide peace of mind to aircraft owners and operators of virtually all makes and models of aircraft, engines and auxiliary power units (APUs).

column2: Leasing provides aircraft parts, leasing and supply chain solutions. From a single bolt to a complete engine, customers gain access to an inventory of over 45,000 aircraft parts, engines and APUs and a global vendor network to source assets for anything that flies. All backed by the buying power and expertise of JSSI, one of the largest purchasers of parts and maintenance services in the aviation industry.

column1: *JSSI Advisory Services utilizes JSSI’s technical expertise and global network to deliver desktop appraisals by ASA-accredited appraisers, asset inspections, technical advice and maintenance event management. Trusted aviation advisors draw on decades of technical knowledge, experience and real-world data to consult clients.

*Traxxall provides software-as-a-service (“SaaS”) solutions for aircraft maintenance tracking, parts inventory management services, and cloud-based software to enhance the maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) workflow.
*SierraTrax offers simple, intuitive, and affordable maintenance tracking software for business aircraft to manage aircraft maintenance, logbooks, records and regulatory compliance.

column2: de Decker enables aircraft owners and operators to make more informed decisions. More than 35 years of objective and impartial data powers digital tools to analyze aircraft ownership options with the most accurate performance and comparison data available, and review critical state tax information.

column1: Traxxall is seeking a well-qualified Aircraft Maintenance Analyst to be based at our Montreal, Canada location.

Traxxall provides aircraft/fleet owner-operators and maintenance managers with quick and easy visibility to all aspects of their associated OEM Maintenance Program or AAIP. As a Software as a Service (SaaS) product, Traxxall provides each account with an experienced Account Representative to assist them in learning, using, updating, and obtaining exceptional value out of the application. The Aircraft Maintenance Analyst’s primary responsibility is the professional, timely, and accurate update of aircraft maintenance records (in various forms) into the Traxxall Application.</section>",[]

39,Aircraft equipment maintenance,Randstad Canada,"Dorval, QC",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/aircraft-equipment-maintenance-dorval-10--cd4b2c75-aa93-4b17-9606-86c31cf740fd?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.11&_ga=2.165770169.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
If you want to join a family business in Dorval and be part of a dynamic team in industrial maintenance. If you are an expert in corrective maintenance, then we have the perfect maintenance position for you!

Position: Aircraft equipment maintenance
Location: Dorval
Salary: 25$ to 27$
Schedule: Day shift, Monday to Friday
Industry: Aeronautics

Advantages
- Company with a good team spirit offering a job in a trending industry
column3: - Collective insurance (Health and dental)
column4:
- Day shift with flexible hours.

Responsibilities
- Inspections of all aircraft equipment with the collaboration of another technician
column5: - Proceed with the maintenance required in the manuals
column6: - Read, understand and follow processes/procedures, maintaining a maximum of quality workmanship
column7:
- Repair inflatable equipment for aircraft: such as life rafts, escape slides and life jackets. This includes, rigging a unit (attaching various parts such as locator lights and cylinder), tie various knots, deflate unit, press unit and fold following a specific procedure.


Qualifications
- Mechanical background
- Must be able to read, understand and follow instructions set out in technical manuals (in English) and follow work instructions.
- Being mechanically inclined and having a familiarity with tools an asset.
- Training will be provided.
- Have a good understanding in aircraft equipments.

Summary
If you are interested in the position then contact me immediately at georges.azouri@randstad.ca

If you know people who might be interested in this position then give them our information and tell them to contact us as a referral bonus of $200 is available for you. They just have to mention your name.

Are you already employed and looking to improve your working conditions? Apply without fear! Our privacy policies are very clear: we will not communicate with your current employer without your consent.

Glad to know you!

George

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. Inland Technologies

Aircraft Fueller

YOW â€“ Ottawa International Airport

The members of the Inland Group of Companies (Inland Technologies, IDS and Quantem Aviation Services) are highly experienced in environmental management, aircraft de-icing, ground handling and pretty much any other aviation support service you can think of. We operate at over 50 airports in four countries. Inland Technologies core business is the delivery of airport environmental compliance programs. We are continuously innovating the technologies we use to provide our range of services including, spent aircraft de-icing fluid collection and recycling, wastewater management, and aircraft de-icing fluid manufacturing for reuse.

Our business is built on a foundation of excellence in customer service, innovation and continuous improvement and safety is at the forefront of everything we do.  We provide a workplace where respect, integrity and a high degree of ethical behaviour is a minimum expectation.  To learn more about our organization, please visit our website at:
column2:
text-decoration:underline"">www.inlandgroup.ca

 

We are currently providing an opportunity for a well-rounded safety focused individual to join our team in the position of Aircraft Fueller at our YOW Ottawa International Airport station.

 

About You:

The ideal candidate will be someone who is passionate about safety, doesnâ€™t shy away from a challenge and is comfortable working in an environment where the noise level can be excessive at times.

 

About the Position:

Aside from the excitement of working in all weather (SNOW, RAIN, WIND, and whatever else Mother Nature deems necessary), the essential duties and responsibilities of this position include:

41,Aircraft Refueler,Viking Air Limited,"Sidney, BC",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/aircraft-refueler--d1739268-7257-4b4c-a347-7b1df6da46b4?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.13&_ga=2.165770169.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

Viking is seeking an Aircraft Refueler in our World Fuels division in Victoria.

The Aircraft Refueler is primarily responsible for the servicing and refueling of aircraft at airport facilities. Adheres to all standards, procedures ensuring all work is performed safely and is supported by following established procedures and protocols.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Perform daily Quality Control checks on equipment.
  • Perform fueling in safe and efficient manner.
  • Responsible for accurate accounting of fuel transactions.
  • Maintain equipment in clean and functional condition.
  • Ensure the correct loading and balancing of fuel.
  • Use fuel trucks to fuel aircraft.
  • Lift and move up to 50 lbs. of material and equipment.
  • Calculating fuel distributions for a variety of aircraft.
  • Driving a variety of light and heavy-duty vehicles.
  • Ensure tasks are performed in accordance with Company and Airline specific procedures and policies.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

EXPERIENCE AND/OR EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • A Class 3 Drivers license with Air Brake Endorsement.
  • Restricted Radio Operator Permit for Air.
  • Ability to qualify and hold a Restricted Area Pass.
  • Hold or Obtain Airside Vehicle Operator Permit class 'D'.
  • Experience with aircraft and an airport environment.
column2:
line-height:15pt"">PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

Must be able to meet all physical duties required of the Department.

42,Boeing 737 Mechanic (Canada),Coulson Group,"Port Alberni, BC",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/boeing-737-mechanic-canada-port-alberni-02--413027bb-c95b-4746-8400-1f62b167bf39?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.14&_ga=2.165770169.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

 

ABOUT THE COMPANY:

 

Global Leaders in Aerial Firefighting

Coulson Aircrane Ltd. is a privately owned family company based in Port Alberni, British Columbia, Canada. The company has over 110,000 safe flight hours and has been in the aviation business for over 29 years
column2:
operating a diverse fleet of both fixed wing and rotary wing aircraft.

The company's operations include helicopter logging, forest fire suppression, power-line construction, airliner passenger transport and many other industrial heavy lift operations. The fleet is geared for mobility and self-sufficiency and is supported by mobile fuel tankers and aircraft maintenance service vehicles staffed with qualified engineers. These helicopter aviation services are provided to clients on a ""turn key"" basis.

Coulson Aviation (USA) Inc. was founded in 1990 as a wholly owned subsidiary of Coulson Aircrane Ltd. From 1990 to 1993 Coulson Aviation (USA) provided the personnel for extensive heli-logging operations in Alaska. In the succeeding years, Coulson Aviation (USA) purchased its first C-130 Hercules that currently holds contracts within the United States and Australia. A second C-130 Hercules was acquired for the program in 2015 to accommodate the growing need for large air tankers.

Coulson Aircrane Ltd. (Port Alberni, BC) operate a Business and Quality Management System certified to ISO 9001:2015 + AS9100D for the Manufacture of parts and assemblies, including post-delivery support.

Coulson Aviation (Australia) PTY Ltd was created in 2010 to support Coulson Aircrane's long term operations and commitment to its Australian Customers. It was setup as a wholly owned subsidiary of Coulson Aircrane Ltd. to provide aircraft personnel for Coulson’s rotary and fixed wing aircraft operating under contract in Australia for Firefighting and OffShore Oil applications.

 

 

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

 

Coulson Aviation USA has an opening for a 737 Mechanic.  We operate a fleet of aircraft that includes: 737, C130, S61, S76, UH60, and CH47 aircraft, primarily in a firefighting capacity (USFS, Cal Fire, Australia).  We offer industry competitive pay and benefits with 401K, overtime, travel, lodging, per diem, and health insurance.  This rotational position does not require you to relocate.  You can live anywhere in Canada as we will cover the cost for you to travel to and from your home.

 

We are searching for a hardworking candidate with a very strong attention to detail. 

Field experience as a flight mechanic will also be an asset as we continue to grow.

 

Job Duties:

  • Must travel with aircraft when needed
  • All aspects of hangar and line maintenance
  • Project Management and Planning
  • Able to make proper log entries as required by the Federal Aviation Regulations (FARs)
  • Work closely with the Director of Maintenance/Chief Inspector
  • Liaise with Management and Crew to complete deadlines
  • Maintain the 737-300 to the applicable regulatory standards
  • Work individually or in a multi crew environment


 

Requirements

  • Valid FAA A&
column3:
P certification
  • CA AME (preferred)
  • B737-300 General Familiarization course (preferred)
  • 3+ years of B737  line maintenance experience (preferred)
  • Heavy maintenance experience including engine removal and installations
  • Valid Drivers’ License and Passport
  • Willing and able to travel internationally
  • Must have strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Read and comprehend technical publications
  • Must have own basic hand tools


    • Additional experience, education and/or skills

     

    • Security background check may be required.
    • Aviation knowledge is required.

43,Mechanic,Waste Management,"Coquitlam, BC",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/mechanic-coquitlam-02--f4251c7b-17ef-42f1-b5c7-7df6a9a9ec6e?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.15&_ga=2.165770169.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
Mechanic - ( 21023135 )

Primary Location : Canada-British Columbia-Coquitlam

Flexible Work Location Acceptable: : No

Shift : Evening

Travel : No

Compensation: : 43.33/hr

FLSA Status : Non-exempt

Job : Technician/Mechanic

Equal Opportunity Employer

What is the value of a WM job?

The value of a WM job is more than a paycheck. It’s one way to create opportunities for you and your family.

We Are People First: We foster an environment where all teammates feel welcomed, valued and seen

We Are Committed to Growth: Training and progressive opportunities for professional development

We Are Stable: Our employees are at home every day and doing essential and meaningful work

We Are Investing in You: Competitive compensation, significant benefits, people first and much more!

Who are we? #WeAreWM

_Ready to roll with us?_ Click Apply to join the Waste Management team today.

Waste Management (WM), a Fortune 250 company, is the leading provider of comprehensive waste and environmental services in North America. We are strongly committed to a foundation of operating excellence, professionalism and financial strength. WM serves nearly 25 million customers in residential, commercial, industrial and municipal markets throughout North America through a network of collection operations, transfer stations, landfills, recycling facilities and waste-based energy production projects.

Join our Waste Management team, the industry leader since 1971. With over 41,000 proud employees, Waste Management has the largest trucking fleet in the waste industry - over 18,000 trucks, and leads in CNG advancement with the largest fleet of class 8 Natural Gas Vehicles in North America. We offer opportunities in 48 states, the District of Columbia, and Canada.

Tired of just doing preventative maintenance or working only on engines? Are you ready to take the next step and work on equipment that requires a high level of skill - hydraulics, electrical, diagnostics - using modern maintenance practices and technologies? Are you looking for that right opportunity which will allow you to use and be rewarded for your skills and ability, and provide opportunity for growth? Our technicians are trained to provide superior maintenance on both diesel equipment and, at some locations, on our growing fleet of CNG trucks. We care about our technician’s safety and show it by demanding solid safety practices of all our technicians and managers. Pride, safety, training, growth, opportunity, great benefits, rewards – check us out, we may be the company for you.

I. Job Summary

Under general supervision, performs preventive maintenance services and inspects, diagnoses and repairs vehicles and equipment.

II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the essential duties satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned and may vary by location.

+ Works under limited supervision and selects from written instructions and established procedures to accomplish assigned tasks.

+ Performs repairs and assigned preventive maintenance services.

+ Performs inspection, diagnosis and repair of electrical, hydraulic, suspension, brake and air systems on vehicles and equipment.

+ Utilizes vehicle computer electronics systems to interpret failure modes to initiate or assign repairs.

+ Estimates time and material costs on vehicle repairs and requisitions new parts.

+ Performs all work within Standard Repair Times (SRTs).

+ Performs service calls for emergency breakdowns.

+ Conducts safety checks on vehicles.

+ Completes required paperwork utilizing fleet maintenance software program associated with repairing vehicles, documenting parts usage, and accounting for repair times.

+ Reviews, completes or assigns repairs identified on Driver Vehicle Inspection Reports.

+ Maintains a clean, safe work area in compliance with Corporate / OHS Standards, and performs all work in accordance with established safety procedures.

+ Completes all assigned mandatory online and in class training modules.

+ Must have all required tools to fulfill the responsibilities and requirements of the job.

III. Supervisory Responsibilities

This job has no supervisory duties.

IV. Qualifications

The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.

A. Education and Experience

+ Education: None required.

+ Experience: Three (3) years of relative work experience (in addition to education requirement).

B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements

+ Valid driver’s license and must have acceptable driving record.

+ Valid Journeyman certificate in one of the following trades
column2:

+ Heavy Equipment Technician (AB),

+ Truck and Transport Mechanic (SK, MB),

+ Commercial Transport Vehicle Mechanic (BC),

+ Heavy Equipment Technician - Truck and Transport Mechanic (NT),

+ Truck and Coach Technician (ON),

+ Truck and Transport Service Technician (NB),

+ Truck and Transport Technician (YT)

C. Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required

+ None required.

V. Work Environment

Listed below are key points regarding environmental demands and work environment of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

+ Required to use motor coordination with finger dexterity (such as keyboarding, machine operation, etc.) most of the work day

Benefits

At Waste Management, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. As well as a Stock Purchase Plan, Company Pension, and more! Our employees also receive Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days. Please note that benefits may vary by site.

If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been looking for, please click ""Apply.”

Job Description:
column2:
margin-bottom:0.0001pt"">Mechanic  

Public Works â€“ Operations Support

Contract Full-Time - Twelve (12) Months

CUPE  Local 966

 

Reporting to the Foreperson Fleet Services you will perform repairs and maintenance  of Regional cars, dump trucks, snow clearing and construction equipment, and small engines and ambulances.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Plan and schedule duties according to work priorities and requirements as directed
  • Diagnose and repair vehicles and equipment
  • Perform scheduled preventative maintenance and annual safety inspections as required
  • Ensure work is performed safely, efficiently within the time allotted and in accordance with legislated standards
  • Install and repair specialized vehicle accessories and safety equipment
  • Order and receive replacement or repair parts as directed and keep stock area in neat and tidy condition
  • Supply and use own hand tools to carry out maintenance and repair duties
  • Accurately complete forms, reports and input/retrieve information into Fleet Management System
  • Execute duties in a tactful manner and maintain a neat appearance to portray a positive image of the Region of Peel
  • Will be required to perform emergency roadside repairs
  • Attend training courses as required

Qualifications:

  • Must hold a current Province of Ontario Motor Vehicle License 310T and 310S preferably with Propane Fuel Tech (P) via TSSA
  • Must hold Ontario Vehicle Operatorâ€™s Permit Class â€œGâ€ in good standing
  • Minimum grade 12 education or equivalent
  • Must be able to read, write and understand English
  • Must be able to complete various work forms and prepare simple written reports
  • Experience, preferably in Fleet Maintenance environment dealing with a variety of light and heavy vehicles and up to date on automotive electronics
  • Experience with diagnostic equipment, ie: scanners, digital meters, tire balancers, brake lathes, and AC filling and testing equipment  

Preference will be given to qualified applicants who are currently in the bargaining unit

 

Location:  2 Copper Road, Brampton, ON

As part of the Regionâ€™s ongoing commitment to health and safety, there are enhanced Covid-19 specific safety protocols and/or personal protective equipment requirements (e.g. masks, eye protection, etc.) in place to help protect health and safety. The additional requirements are determined based on the nature of the work being carried out.

 

New employees who commence employment on or after October 1, 2021 are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Being fully vaccinated is determined as the status of having received the full series of approved vaccines (both doses of a two dose vaccine series, one dose of a single dose vaccine series) and any additional doses required and approved by Health Canada and having satisfied the full post vaccination period required to ensure vaccination efficacy. The Region of Peel reserves the right to request proof of vaccination at any time. Acceptable proof includes an Ontario Ministry of Health COVID-19 vaccine receipt which you can obtain through the Provincial portal https://covid19.ontariohealth.ca/, or other government-issued vaccine passport or certification.

 

The requirement to be fully vaccinated is subject to the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you are not fully vaccinated, a documented medical reason provided by a physician or registered nurse and time period for the medical reason may be accepted.

About Us:

The Region of Peel serves more than 1.4 million residents and approximately 173,000 businesses in Brampton, Caledon and Mississauga. We deliver a wide range of resident focused services across the Region.

Our 20-year vision for Peel is â€œCommunity for Life.â€ Our goal is to create a place where everyone enjoys a sense of belonging and has access to the services and opportunities needed to thrive in each stage of their lives. Our 2015-2035 Strategic Plan outlines the work we're focused on to bring this vision to life.

To learn more about the Region of Peel, explore  peelregion.ca.

Additional Information:

The Region of Peel is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is respected and valued for their contributions, and where everyone is treated fairly and has opportunity to grow and develop. As one of the most diverse regions in Canada, we are committed to establishing a qualified workforce that is reflective of the population we serve.

As a Service Tech III at United Rentals, you’ll use your skills to perform maintenance and repairs on complex equipment in a safe and professional manner. Every day, you can improve and challenge yourself, and if you have the desire and ambition, you’ll have the potential to work towards higher levels of Service Technician and leadership roles in our Service Department. Like every member of our team, we will rely on you to provide exceptional customer service to our customers.

If you would enjoy the chance to make your mark with the world’s largest equipment rental provider, consider a future with United Rentals. You will be supported by a strong management team that will help you achieve your goals. Plus, you will have the opportunity to relocate to one of our 1,000+ locations.

column12: line-height:16.05px"">Le CN offre de nombreuses possibilités pour les travailleurs de métiers spécialisés qui aiment apprendre constamment et souhaitent faire carrière dans une équipe axée sur la sécurité. Vous travaillerez sur équipements à la fine pointe de la technologie et des wagons de train qui transportent des marchandises du Pacifique à l’Atlantique et jusqu’au golfe du Mexique. Vous serez fiers de votre travail, car vous saurez que vous contribuez à la santé de l’économie. Vous pourrez également améliorer vos compétences grâce à la formation rémunérée. Nous offrons des carrières valorisantes car notre travail fait une différence. Embarquez avec nous!
column32: line-height:16.05px"">Le mécanicien ou la mécanicienne Matériel remorque inspecte, entretient, construit et répare des wagons et du matériel ferroviaire conformément à la réglementation fédérale et aux règles du CN. La personne titulaire du poste est considérée comme étant un apprenti mécanicien ou une apprentie mécanicienne jusqu’à ce que cette personne obtienne le titre de compagnon mécanicien ou de compagne mécanicienne Matériel remorque (consulter la description de la formation ci-dessous).
column41:
font-size:24px"">Principales responsabilités
  • Inspecter les wagons et leurs composants conformément aux règles des associations ferroviaires et de la Federal Railway Administration ainsi qu’aux normes d’exploitation de la Compagnie
  • Effectuer toutes les interventions d’entretien programmées, ponctuelles et préventives et les réparations sur les wagons, le châssis, la charpente, les dispositifs de sécurité, l’appareil de choc et de traction, y compris les essais connexes
  • Réparer et installer des pièces de wagon comme des compresseurs, des valves pneumatiques, des paliers et roulements, des attelages ainsi que des cylindres pneumatiques et des conduits
  • Utiliser des outils à main, des outils à moteur, du matériel de soudage, des chalumeaux oxyacétyléniques et des instruments de mesure
  • Conduire des véhicules de transport, y compris des grues, des camions, des locotracteurs et autre matériel d’atelier.
  • Rédiger des rapports d’inspection, d’entretien et de travaux, et consigner les détails sur les imprimés prévus, conformément aux directives en vigueur
column50:
font-size:24px"">Conditions de travail
  • Travail par quarts, les fins de semaine et les jours fériés, et heures supplémentaires occasionnelles au besoin
  • Travail effectué en partie à l’extérieur dans diverses conditions météorologiques et environnementales
  • Tâches exigeant souvent de se pencher, de se plier, de s’accroupir, de s’agenouiller et de travailler au-dessus de sa tête
column51:
de soulever et de transporter une charge pesant jusqu’à 22 kg (50 livres), et parfois même jusqu’à 39 kg (85 livres)
  • Capacité à monter dans des échelles ou à se tenir en équilibre, ainsi que de tenir des objets
column52:
bonne coordination œil-main
  • Possibilité de devoir travailler loin de son terminal désigné
column61:
font-size:24px"">Exigences
  • Expérience acquise en soudage dans le cadre d’une formation officielle ou d’un travail
  • Diplôme d’études secondaires ou l’équivalent
  • Avoir au moins 18 ans
  • Obligation de répondre à toutes les exigences d’évaluation de l’aptitude au travail pour le poste ainsi qu’à toutes les exigences en matière de sécurité
  • Permis de conduire en règle
  • Capacité à travailler de façon autonome, à s’adapter à des conditions changeantes et à bien gérer le stress
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe et à entretenir des relations positives avec les autres
  • Bonne compréhension orale et écrite et bonnes aptitudes en rédaction
  • Empressement à bien faire son travail tout en respectant les normes de qualité et de sécurité et en assurant la satisfaction du client
  • Connaissance des outils et des instruments électriques et électroniques
  • Capacité à déterminer l’état des objets ou des pièces en ce qui a trait à l’usure ou aux avaries
  • Formation professionnelle ou technique et connaissance des règles d’exploitation ferroviaire
  • Connaissance de base des outils informatiques
column81: line-height:16.05px"">La personne titulaire du poste reçoit une formation pratique comportant des cours tant théoriques que pratiques, sur une période de 3 semaines à raison de 40 heures par semaine. Selon son degré d’expérience, la personne qui occupe ce poste peut être tenue de suivre un programme d’apprentissage de 4 années de pratique spécifique par CN et de participer à une série de cours à son lieu de travail au Canada. La formation comprend les éléments constitutifs du matériel roulant, l’inspection des wagons, les essais de frein sur véhicule individuel, les marchandises spéciales de niveau 2, la réparation de wagons marchandises, les méthodes de levage des wagons, le soudage en milieu ferroviaire, les nacelles élévatrices, les règles d’exploitation en triage et d’autres éléments pertinents pour le poste. La réussite de cette formation est essentielle à l’exécution des futures tâches.
column92: line-height:16.05px"">*Ce poste est syndiqué. Par conséquent, le salaire et les avantages sociaux sont régis par la convention collective en vigueur.
column114:
line-height:16.05px"">En tant que chef de file dans les domaines du transport et de la logistique en Amérique du Nord, nous sommes un véritable pilier de l’économie. Forts d’une équipe d’environ 25 000 cheminots, nous avons pour priorité de faire progresser notre entreprise et l’économie. Nous transportons annuellement des marchandises d’une valeur de 200 G$ US pour un large éventail de secteurs, tels les ressources naturelles, les produits manufacturés et les biens de consommation, sur un réseau de 20 000 milles qui couvre le Canada et le centre des États-Unis. Le CN est la seule entreprise canadienne à figurer dans la catégorie du secteur du transport et de l’infrastructure du transport du Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) World. Créé en 1999, l’indice DJSI World est l’indice de référence en ce qui a trait au développement durable. Au CN, nous travaillons comme UNE ÉQUIPE axée sur la sécurité et nos clients, offrant l’excellence sur le plan de l’exploitation et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement pour produire des résultats.  

Le CN exige que tous lesmembres de son personnel soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 etqu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat devaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales enpropriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents etfournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN auCanada.

La forme grammaticale utilisée dans ce document vaut tant pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Le CN souscrit au principe de l’équité en emploi et invite toutes les personnes qualifiées à présenter leur candidature. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt

48,Mechanic - York 310S/310T,Voyago,"Gormley, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/mechanic-york-310s-310t-gormley-08--87ec39e0-31b4-404e-96c1-081509225f28?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.20&_ga=2.152657086.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

We Are The Employer Brand of Choice. It is our mission to be your best choice when seeking a career in Transportation. We believe in creating lasting relationships with our employees, one built on Trust and Respect.

And our employees would agree, having selected us as a Great Place To Work through the annual survey measuring Employee attitudes at Voyago.

Here’s a look at what makes us A Great Place To Work:

84% Agreed “Voyago is a physically safe place to work…”

80% Agreed “I can be myself at Voyago…”

81% Agreed “Management has kept me well-informed…”

A Great Place To Work Certification means that we take your happiness seriously, and we work hard to ensure you are highly engaged and informed on important topics that keep Voyago on the move.

Help shape the future of mobility. Voyago is currently recruiting for a 310S/310T Mechanic in Gormley, Ontario.

Voyago is Ontario’s Leading Mobility company, a subsidiary of Transdev. We’re hiring dynamic, high achievers looking to be Difference Makers within the industry. Voyago continues to advance across Ontario with our multi-model platform covering a variety of segments including Medical Transportation, Student Transportation, and the Public sector with Medium/Micro Rural and Urban Transit, Accessible Needs Para-Transit, and On Demand Mobility.

Our employee success is built on our commitment and emphasis on training and orientation process. Voyago prides itself on the growth of our employees by supporting and encouraging them to develop skills that lead to successful careers.

Voyago believes in the strength of our people and remains committed to our Golden Values statement reflecting our promise of performance to our employees, customers, and communities in which we operate.

Our teams are continuously recognized as top performers in Safety and Client Satisfaction awards. Voyago is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Safest Employers and a recipient of the Excellence Award for several years.

We are People and Safety First. So come join us and help shape the future of mobility at a Great Place To Work company.

Position Overview

Reporting directly to the Fleet Manager and Shop Supervisor, the Service Technician is responsible for evaluating and ensuring vehicle safety through preventative maintenance as required and all in compliance with all Ministry of Transportation (MTO) and Voyago's guidelines. Utilize parts from inventory or order parts necessary through the Fleet Management software to make repairs. Complete repairs in a timely manner. Service vehicles in accordance with corporate policies and procedures. Keep work environment clean and tidy. Complete required reports as directed (i.e. sign-off on driver initiated repair logs and log books, and PM service logs by division).

The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications that include, but are not limited to, the following:


  • Possess a minimum 310S/ 310T
  • ODP certification with A/C experience.
  • Have experience and working knowledge of light duty diesel repair, as well as gasoline.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills and sound organizational competencies.
  • Demonstrated leadership, problem-solving, and team-building skills.
  • Excellent proven customer service experience.
  • Valid G class driving license.
  • Possess clean driving record and provide a copy for personal file.


  • $ 500.00 Annual tool allowance
  • $100.00 boot allowance
  • Uniforms and Winter Jackets provided and laundered on site
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
  • Employee Referral Bonus
  • Life Insurance, Disability, Health Savings Account
  • Exciting employee perks and discounts with partnering companies and agencies
  • Paid by the hour – for your entire shift
  • Employee Certified “Great Place to Work”
  • Current work week Monday to Friday, with weekends off
  • Rewarding career with a growing company
  • Great company culture
  • Focus on Innovation and Sustainable Environmental Initiatives
  • Subsidiary of Global Transportation Provider (Transdev)


Sounds Interesting? Apply today to our Recruitment Specialist, Narinder Gill via email at narinder.gill@voyago.ca

Voyago is committed to provide accommodation for individuals with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. Accommodations are available upon request of the internal or external applicant. If you require an accommodation due to a disability for an interview, please notify Human Resources directly to make appropriate arrangements when contacted for an interview.

We thank all applicants however only those under consideration will be contacted.

Overview:

Fountain Tire Vaughan (8300 Jane Street) is hiring a Mechanic (Automotive Service Technician)!  

 

At Fountain Tire, our associates are our number one asset. As a member of our team you will get to enjoy some of our great benefits:

  • Competitive compensation ($35 - $45 / hour)
  • Hourly and / or no limit commission structure available
  • Signing bonus!

Your duties will include:

  • Performing scheduled maintenance services such as oil changes, lubrications and tune-ups

  • Ensuring the best service is provided to our clients and customers

What does it take to get on track?

  • Must possess Ontario Class Mechanics license (310S-Automotive)
  • Valid Driverâ€™s License and satisfactory driver's abstract

At Fountain Tire, you'll have a great place to workâ€”competitive compensation, a manager with a large support network, and the chance to learn and grow. Please apply in person or online.

51,J/Mechanic,Finning,"Williams Lake, BC",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/j-mechanic-williams-lake-02--6dc588d4-28c8-4b57-8efc-90b04853ef75?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.23&_ga=2.152657086.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

Company:

Finning Canada

Number of Openings:

2

Worker Type:

Permanent

Position Overview:

Join the Finning Canada family, part of the world’s largest Cat dealer. We are currently looking for a dedicated Heavy Duty Mechanic who will be responsible for the field troubleshooting, maintenance, and repair of a variety of Cat products, based out of our Finning Williams Lake Branch.

This position will work a 7x7, 12-hour continuous shift rotation. If you are a safety conscious team player, self-motivated, autonomous, detail-oriented and possess your Journeyperson Heavy Equipment Technician certification with a valid driver’s license, then you are exactly who we are looking for!

Job Description:

  • Troubleshoot and repair Caterpillar equipment
  • Perform field diagnosis and field running repairs
  • Utilize Caterpillar SIS and ET daily
  • Complete technical documentation (service reports, warranty, crossover notes)
  • Interact with customers, sales support, and the rest of the Finning team
  • Work with the Service Supervisor and Leadhand on various tasks as required

Qualifications

  • Interprovincial Heavy Equipment Technician (HET) Certification
  • Valid driver’s license with a successful recent drivers abstract
  • Safety conscious team player with excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills with a high attention to detail
  • Completion of Finning S-Levels, Failure Analysis, Machine Electronic Controls, or Tier 4 training would be considered an asset
  • Completion of Caterpillar product courses would be considered an asset
  • Previous Caterpillar mining equipment repair experience would be considered an asset

Notes

  • This position is located at the Finning Williams Lake location on a 7x7 continuous shift rotation
  • Candidate selection will be in compliance with the terms of the current collective agreement

We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.

Wonderbrands, is a leading North American bakery (formerly Weston Foods, fresh and frozen businesses) with 140 years of experience in baking packaged breads, artisan breads, and donuts.  We are one of the largest bakeries in North America and makers of Wonder Bread, Country Harvest, D’Italiano, Gadoua, and Casa Mendosa.

Wonderbrands, a division of FGF Brands, is unlocking an incredible opportunity for growth through a focus on production innovation capabilities, through a leading edge supply chain practice and investing deeply in communities where we bake.  We are hiring to build a robust  Talent and Development team to support our bakeries and Team Members.

The Millwright is a member of the maintenance team and as such, participates in team efforts to achieve assigned department goals
column2: works closely with other team members to ensure all maintenance activities are completed on time, according to SOPs and regulatory requirements
column3:
and provides support to other roles within the maintenance team.

As a member of the maintenance team, your primary responsibility includes perform install, examine, replace or repair components
column4: trouble shoot mechanical systems and building services. In addition, you will provide technical support to production teams in supporting production uptime, ensuring optimal functioning of the production equipment and facilities. This position provides critical support in reducing production down time, maintaining overhaul programs, preventive maintenance of equipment, and effective troubleshooting and repair of equipment. The Millwright is a member of the maintenance team and as such, participates in team efforts to achieve assigned department goals
column5: works closely with other team members to ensure all maintenance activities are completed on time, according to SOPs and regulatory requirements

and provides support to other roles within the maintenance team.

Job Details:

  • Steady night shifts consisting 10 or 12 Hour Shifts. Must be flexible to work Weekends, OT as needed.  
  • Great working environment
  • Opportunity for growth and development
  • $40.81/hr 
  • Premiums for additional certifications
  • Additional Night Shift Premium $2/hr 
  • Additional Dual Ticket Premium $1 

Job Duties:

  • Read blueprints, diagrams and schematic drawings to determine work procedures
  • Install, troubleshoot and maintain power transmission, vacuum, hydraulic and pneumatic systems, and programmable logic controls
  • Inspect and examine machinery and equipment to detect and investigate irregularities and malfunctions
  • Adjust machinery and repair or replace defective parts
  • Operate machine tools such as lathes and mill machines to fabricate parts required during overhaul, maintenance or set-up of machinery
  • Assemble machinery and equipment prior to installation using hand and power tools and welding equipment.
  • Troubleshooting/repairs/installations of processing equipment with a working knowledge of electrical to allow efficient repair/replacement results
  • Extensive mechanical knowledge including power transmission, pneumatics and hydraulics
  • Optimize equipment safety, efficiency and reliability, participating in continuous improvement projects and completing work orders according to PM schedules
  • Comply with all applicable legislative and Bakery food safety, health and safety and environmental policies and procedures.
  • Service, clean and perform preventative maintenance and overhaul on all production and bakery equipment
  • Continually improve equipment function via design improvements
  • Ensure that work area is clean of debris and hazards at all times and check work area for such hazards upon arrival and when departing each area of work
  • Work in a safe manner in accordance with legislated and company health and safety standards
  • Perform other related duties as assigned or required.

    Job Requirements

    • Not necessarily but good to have a Red Seal Millwright License or 4th or 3rd level apprentice
    • Preferably with 5 years industrial manufacturing mechanical experience
    • Proven track record working with mechanics, machine shop practices (lathe &
column7: milling machines), welding (ARC, TIG, MIG), and pneumatic &amp
column8:
hydraulic fields is required.
  • Problem-solving skills and good communication skills are required.
  • Ability to work at night, Sunday to Saturday, and holidays.

    •  

    If you are interested, apply now and let's schedule a conversation!

53,Mechanic,Forbes Bros Ltd.,"Melfort, SK",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/mechanic-melfort-11--17422d58-7a6d-422d-a612-7b6216cad557?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.25&_ga=2.152657086.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

To support operational growth, Forbes Bros is looking for a Commercial Transport or Heavy Equipment Mechanic to join our team. Reporting to the Fleet Maintenance Lead, the Mechanic maintains, repairs and overhauls heavy vehicles and industrial equipment at our Prince Albert, Saskatchewan location.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform preventative and corrective maintenance of all systems associated with work equipment (mechanical, electrical, pneumatic, and hydraulic)
  • When required performs field service calls
  • Evaluate parts for reuse, repair, or replacement
  • Confer on a regular basis with Manager on any operational deficiencies
  • Use various hand and power hand tools. Candidate must supply metric and std hand tools up to 1 1/2"" (38mm) socket and wrench size and chest that is suitably equipped for general mechanical work in a heavy fleet shop.
  • Operates equipment such as overhead or mobile cranes and forklifts to assist in assignments
  • Diagnose equipment problems and take corrective action to minimize the impact on crew production
  • Adapts to new methods, processes, material, and equipment
  • Prepare and submit equipment maintenance records, time sheets, etc.
  • Follows prescribed safety procedures including the use of safety clothing and equipment
  • Ensures cleanliness and organization of shop, maintenance of shop tools and equipment, loading/unloading and storage of equipment, including service trucks
  • Working on heavy duty and on road equipment such as excavators, wheel Loaders, backhoes, digger derrick trucks, aerial bucket trucks, trailers, and dump trucks
  • Assists other Technicians as needed

Requirements:

  • Self-directed, outgoing personality and a team player
  • Well organized with attention to detail
  • Service orientated with strong communication skills
  • Ability to deal effectively with others in a diverse environment
  • Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and manage timelines effectively
  • Strong mechanical aptitude with effective interpersonal skills
  • Critical thinker
  • Experience working in a fleet shop
  • Fluent in English both written and spoken
  • Legally allowed to work in Canada
  • Gas, electrical welding, and fabrication skills an asset
  • Proficiency using diagnostic software, meters, gauges etc.
  • Experienced with Electrical, Hydraulic and Pneumatic system repairs and maintenance
  • Physically fit with the ability to work in conditions which may include varying weather and temperatures, heavy lifting (50 lbs / 23 kgs) and cramped quarters.
  • Ability to work through ambiguously worded driver repair requests by drilling down to the root cause and performing effective repairs
  • Willing to work overtime, weekends and after-hours emergency service call ins as required



Education and Experience:

  • (Red Seal) Journeyman Inter Provincial Truck and Transport Mechanic and/or Heavy Equipment Technician Certification. TQ's will also be considered.
  • High school graduation or BCAGD.
  • CVIP Inspectors licence an asset
  • BC Crane Safety Certificate min. level: Crane Mechanic Certification an asset
  • Forklift operators Certificate an asset
  • Class 3 license with air, a clean Drivers Abstract, Class 1 Driver's License will be considered an asset
  • Minimum 6 years shop and field experience
  • Experience repairing and servicing digger derrick trucks, aerial bucket trucks, small and medium sized construction equipment, back hoe's, dump trucks, utility vans, light duty trucks, various types of trailers and another equipment and vehicles that could be found working in a civil construction and overhead powerline company
  • Hydraulic, aerial manlift, digger derrick and crane service training courses or certifications considered an asset

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

Rodzaj stanowiska: Stałe
Miejscowość:Kostrzyn nad Odrą

 

Opis grupy
Grupa Mechatronics, Mirrors and Lighting specjalizuje się w technologiach motoryzacyjnych, które kształtują przyszłość mobilności. Czerpiąc z głębokiej wiedzy o systemach, MML opracowuje wyjątkowe technologie dostępu do pojazdów, inteligentne systemy wizyjne i zaawansowane technologie oświetlenia pojazdów, wytyczając nowe drogi do innowacyjności, bezpieczeństwa i stylistyki.

55,310T Mechanic (FT),CanadianCraneRentals.com,"Wingham, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/310t-mechanic-ft-wingham-08--ad83e53c-52bf-49de-a059-9262e91f6273?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.27&_ga=2.152657086.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
About the Job:
Our company’s goal is to maintain our company’s heavy construction equipment and trucks to the highest standards. We have a great working environment and employees are appreciated for good work.

Requirements:
  • Experience with maintenance and repair of heavy-duty equipment and trucks.
  • Knowledge of mechanical troubleshooting along with preventive maintenance, diagnosis, and repair.
  • Knowledge of the mechanics of hydraulics equipment.
  • Preferably experience with Electronic tools and Diagnostic Equipment.
  • Must have own tools and transportation.
  • DZ or AZ license- preferred not mandatory.
  • Valid passport- candidates will be required to travel to the USA for extended training at the manufacturer.
  • Saturday shifts required.

We Offer:
  • Competitive wages based on experience and benefits package.
  • Clean and safe working environment.
  • Training and continued education towards heavy construction equipment and truck repairs.

Required experience:
  • Mechanic experience of 5 years.

Required Education:
  • Diploma/Certificate.

Benefits:
  • Wellness programs.
  • Life insurance.
  • Dental care.
  • Vision care.
  • Vacation &

    We welcome applications from all qualified candidates and are an equal opportunity employer.
