56,Mechanic (Ad Hoc),Parker Wellbore,"St. John'S, NL",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/mechanic-ad-hoc-st-john-s-05--eae753ed-c373-4579-ab73-bcbf628b795f?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.28&_ga=2.152657086.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
Company Description

Parker Wellbore helps energy companies accomplish their drilling and production goals efficiently, reliably, and safely. Our global team supports oil and gas operators with innovative land and offshore drilling services, premium rental tools and well services, and advanced operations and management support. Founded in 1934, Parker Wellbore helps customers manage their costs and mitigate their risks, to achieve their operational goals in a safe and efficient manner. With experience in both harsh-environment regions and complex drilling situations, you can trust Parker Wellbore to get the job done.Job Description

The Mechanic position performs all tasks and duties of a mechanical discipline including but not limited to, installing and maintaining engines, hydraulic motors, pumps, compressors, and miscellaneous mechanical devices. The position is responsible for all mechanical drilling equipment pertaining to the drilling of the well, including circulating, rotating, hoisting or well control systems. The position is also responsible for uploading maintenance and repair data into a Maintenance Management System (MMS).

Essential functions

  • Provide visible leadership with a Total Ownership attitude. Owns safety standards.
  • Enforce, clarify, and follow Company policies, standards, and procedures.
  • Support the HSE objective of no injuries, accidents or harm to the environment as it relates to all mechanical processes, procedures, and policies.
  • Promote operational excellence through procedural discipline.
  • Delegate work effectively with a clear definition of requirements and expectations.
  • Supervise and ensure the safety of those working under direct supervision.
  • Comply with platform emergency response plan or station bills during emergencies and/ or drills.
  • Responsible for morale and order within crew.
  • Ensure Parker Drilling’s Competency program – Authorized To Operate (ATO) and Approved Competent Operator (ACO) are applied and followed.
  • Ensure Client competency compliance is applied and followed.
  • Understand LO/TO and Permit to Work procedures.
  • Maintain and repair mechanical equipment and devices.
  • Repair or replace defective or worn parts.
  • Lubricate and service mechanical equipment as specified on lubrication schedule.
  • Perform inspections of mechanical equipment as required.
  • Perform preventative and corrective maintenance on mechanical equipment.
  • Maintain a preventative maintenance schedule for all mechanical equipment.
  • Adjust or regulate functional parts of machinery, devices, and control instruments.
  • Troubleshoot and analyze mechanical malfunctions and failures.
  • Read and analyze mechanical drawings, schematics and equipment manuals.
  • Enter maintenance and repair data into a Maintenance Management System (MMS).
  • Create Job requests and work orders as required and enter into maintenance tracking system.
  • Coordinate with Rig Superintendent/Maintenance lead on the maintenance, repair and refurbishment of equipment.
  • Foresee potential equipment malfunctions or failures and preforms required repairs, adjustments or modification to resolve the problem.
  • Respond to emergencies as requested and coordinate onsite activities to utilize resources to facilitate repairs in the most expedient and cost effective manner.
  • Ensure an adequate amount of spare parts are on hand at all times.
  • Submit requisitions to Rig Manager/Purchasing Manager for approval.
  • Maintain records of all mechanical inventories and place orders as required within budgetary limits.
  • Set up and operate lathe, drill press, grinder and other metalworking tools to fascinate any necessary repairs.
  • Perform additional duties, responsibilities, and special projects as may be directed.

Additional functions

N/A

Qualifications

Necessary qualifications, skills and abilities

  • Able to identify and understand functionality of various rig equipment.
  • Must possess and maintain certifications and licenses necessary as required by the appropriate regulatory authorities.
  • Knowledgeable and proficient in basic rigger’s role to ensure safe lifting operations are performed.
  • Knowledgeable of mechanical systems and be skilled at working with hand and power tools.
  • Must possess mathematical skills required for certification as a mechanic.
  • Must have proficient knowledge of diagnostic equipment.
  • Must be a self-motivator and work without close supervision.
  • Must be able to prioritize jobs and work under tight time constraints.
  • Must have good PC skills to include MS Office products.
  • Can demonstrate knowledge and fundamentals of the following equipment: o Hoisting equipment o Pipe handling equipment o Rotating equipment o Circulating equipment o Hydraulic equipment o Diesel engine/air compressors
  • Must possess sound reasoning skills, good common sense and have the ability to follow directions.
  • Must not pose a direct threat or significant risk of substantial harm to the safety or health of him/her or others.
  • Must be able to recognize hazards, alarms, warnings and the ability to convey these to the proper personnel.
  • Must have good verbal communication skills and be able to effectively communicate in English with staff, management, customers and vendors.
  • Education, experience, and certifications:
  • High School diploma is required.
  • Successful completion of a course in practical skills for marine engineers or in diesel mechanics at a recognized training institution.
  • Must be able to obtain appropriate offshore or, onshore certifications
  • Should have at least 5 years of work experience as a mechanic, oil and gas industry preferred. Secondary vocational education, Electrical Safety certificate (required group)
column2:
Man Lift Operator License and Tractor Driver License (if required) 3-5 years` work experience on a rig

Position competencies

  • Initiating &
column3:
Driving Change • Acts as a catalyst for and takes responsibility for leading, directing, and managing organizational change
  • Develops new insights into situations and applies innovative solutions
  • Creates work environment that encourages creative thinking and innovation
  • Drives step changes in how the company operates
  • Understands how to change and addresses not only systems and processes, but also cultural aspects of change
  • Is good at bringing the creative ideas of others to market
  • Develops a change strategy that includes milestones and timelines
  • Accurately assesses the potential barriers and resources necessary for change initiatives
  • Understands and supports the need for change
  • Envisions and articulates the intended result of the change process
  • Provides direction and focus during the change process
  • Helps to generate support of the changes throughout the organization
  • Identifies and enlists allies who support the change process
  • Provides resources, removes barriers, and acts as an advocate for those initiating change
  • Result Focused • Establishes clear, specific performance goals, expectations, and priorities
  • Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully
  • Is constantly and consistently one of the top performers
  • Very bottom-line oriented
  • Steadfastly pushes self and others for results
  • Navigates quickly and effectively to resolve problems and obstacles
  • Persists to complete tasks / responsibilities, even in the face of difficulties
  • Develops a sense of urgency in others to complete tasks
  • Operates with personal ownership and looks for ways to improve performance all the time
  • Challenges him- or herself and others to raise the bar on performance
  • Focuses people on critical activities that yield a high impact
  • Holds self and others accountable for delivering high-quality results on time and within budget (e.g., models high work standards and demands the same from others)
  • Team Work • Blends people into teams when they are needed
  • Creates strong morale and spirit in his/her team
  • Shares wins and successes
  • Fosters open dialogue
  • Lets people finish and be responsible for their work
  • Seeks consensus among diverse viewpoints as a means of building group commitment
  • Defines success in terms of the whole team
  • Creates a feeling of belonging in the team
  • Values the contributions of all team members
  • Creates an environment that encourages open communication amongst team members
  • Creates an environment that encourages collective problem solving amongst team members
  • Customer Focus • Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers
  • Gets first-hand customer information and uses it to understand customers' business issues and needs for improvements in products and services
  • Acts with customer in mind
  • Establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect
  • Genuinely enjoys working with customers to build long-term partnerships
  • Creates a sense of customer focus throughout their team/ department/ business unit

    • Physical demands and work environment

    • Ability to gather, analyze, and interpret data.
    • Ability to work around moving machinery
    • Ability to perform under stress, under pressure, and/or in emergency situations.
    • Lift, carry, and move objects of up to 50 pounds.
    • Operate machinery and/or power tools.
    • Ability to walk on uneven ground (gravel, rocks, mounds, ice)
    • Wear personal protective equipment, including but not limited to hard hat, steel-toed safety shoes, hearing protection, respirators, safety glasses, goggles and full body harness.
    • Frequently stand, walk, stoop, kneel, carry, push/pull, reach, and use repetitive wrist and hand movements.
    • Ability to ascend and descend ladders, stairs, scaffolding, and/or ramps while carrying tools requiring a reasonable degree of physical stamina and agility and involving moderate to severe physical exertion
    • Ability to work in adverse weather conditions (Cold or Heat)
    • Ability to multitask, work in a fast-paced environment, meet deadlines, reason logically, and make sound decisions.
    • Ability to comprehend, remember, and follow verbal and written directions and comply with Company policies, procedures and standard.
    • Ability to work in hazardous conditions (dust/gas/fumes/steam/chemicals)
    • Ability to work at heights (scaffolding or ladders)
    • Exposure to vibration (oscillating movements of the extremities or whole body)
    • Ability to work in noisy environments
    • Ability to work in small and/or enclosed spaces
    • Ability to work as a team, communicate and interact with others in a professional manner, and consider alternative and diverse perspectives.


    Additional Information

    Additional qualifications, skills and abilities

    •  The employee will be required to meet all standards required for safe operations, including but not limited to the standards set forth in the Canadian Association of Petroleum Producers Atlantic Canada Medical Assessment for Fitness to Work Offshore as well as any other standards set forth by regulatory bodies having jurisdiction over the operations.
    • The employee must stay mentally alert for entire regular shift and must have the ability of simultaneously rapid mental coordination.
    • This position will be located offshore Newfoundland and Labrador on the Hibernia platform and is subject to extreme temperatures and environments.
    • Travel to and from the work location may require extended layovers in unfamiliar locations by helicopter or boat.
    • This position will be required on an ad hoc basis to execute defined scopes of work or to meet increasing workloads.

    Consistent with the Accords Act, residents of Newfoundland and Labrador specifically and Canada generally, who are qualified, will be given first consideration for employment.

    Parker Wellbore provides equal opportunity for all people and will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, genetic information, military service, veteran’s status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

    If an applicant has a disability, the applicant may request accommodations when needed to enable that person to perform their essential job functions or to allow that person to participate in employment.

Position : Mechanic
Schedule : Monday-Friday flexible, 10 hours between 6am-5pm
Salary : $19-$24/hr based on experience
Location : Ottawa
Industry: Construction Equipment Repair and Maintenance

Are you looking to start a career as a mechanic? Are you interested in becoming a heavy equipment mechanic? Are you technically inclined, have a set of tools? Do you have experience changing oil and doing minor electrical repairs? If you’re a hard worker and want to learn from an experienced team, this opportunity could be for you!





Advantages
-Salary: $19 - $24/hour based on experience
-Permanent full-time work with overtime available
-Schedule : Monday-Friday flexible, 10 hours between 6am-5pm
-Benefits include health, vision, dental
-RRSP matching as well as a stock share program
-Start with 2 weeks of vacation plus personal and floater days
-All specialty tools are provided

-Perform maintenance tasks such as checking and changing fluids

-Assist the team to ensure equipment is repaired properly and on time
-Follow all health and safety procedures when maintaining and operating machines
-Complete paperwork as required
-Maintain a clean and safe working environment

Qualifications
-Understanding of basic mechanical and electrical principles

-Strong teamwork and communication skills
-No afraid to get hands dirty

58,Lead Mechanic – Automotive – (CAT 23),Air Canada,"DORVAL, QC",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/lead-mechanic-automotive-cat-23-dorval-10--7fa7782a-8e54-4e00-9b12-535721894155?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.30&_ga=2.152657086.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.

Air Canada is presently looking for a dynamic individual to fill a permanent full- time position as of a Lead Ground Support Equipment (GSE) Mechanic.

The Lead GSE is responsible to ensure there is a proper coverage of Cat23/24 on all shifts. The incumbent will be responsible for the Parts Status/Parts here reports (maintain it throughout the shift), ordering of parts (ensure all correct parts are ordered the first time), checking incoming parts in Sage and ensure parts are picked up and signed. This position also ensures that all PMI’s are completed within the allotted times and all snags are reviewed with the mechanics The Lead GSE ensures the weekly shop safety audit is completed, signed off and necessary repairs to equipment carried by the Health and Safety committee members following a review with the Manager.

The Lead GSE maintenance professionals should have the following skill sets:

  • Knowledge of drive-trains, diesel and gasoline engines, propane fuel systems, complex electrical and hydraulic systems, and metal fabrication and welding.
  • Candidates should be able to read and understand various schematic diagrams for maintenance troubleshooting and be proficient with computers and diagnostic tools.
  • Individuals need to be ""team players"" with excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to maintain a customer focused attitude in a demanding, high stress environment.

  • High School diploma.
  • ValidAutomotive Service Technician, Commercial Transport Mechanic orHeavy Duty Mechanic trades certification.
  • Aminimum of five (5) years experience in the trade.
  • Able to successfully pass the pre-employment qualifying exam.

Assets

  • Advanced Fuel Injection &
column2:
Diesel Engine Tune-Up certificates/licenses.
  • Air Conditioning and Refrigeration certificates/licenses.
  • Previous experience maintaining Airline support equipment, mobile ground power generators, air conditioners (up to 110 ton), air start units (compressors up to 250 cfm), but will also consider experience in Farm or Heavy Industrial equipment.
  • First-Aid
  • EV Technologies

    • Linguistic requirements

    • Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.

    Diversity and Inclusion

    Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.

    As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

    Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest

59,Mechanic - S,The Agency by Workland,Saint-Jean-Sur-Richelieu,https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/mechanic-s-saint-jean-sur-richelieu-10--a7c58e57-2fbc-4dcc-8a41-da86d24c749d?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.31&_ga=2.161913915.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

Tired of being a number in a company that does not properly reward and recognize you for your hard work and dedication?

Looking to take part in the adventure of creating and developing an industry success story that will allow you to fast track your career development in a dynamic work environment, where you can really make a difference?

Then this opportunity is for you !

ABOUT THE COMPANY

Sunset Converting Corp is more than a paper converter, it is the inspiring story of three well-known and respected industry experts, who decided to combine their strengths to create a huge success.

Based on the South Shore of Montreal, Sunset Converting Corp is building a new, ultra-automated plant for the transformation of tissue paper products for the North American redistribution market. 

The company is currently looking for an experienced Mechanic, passionate about the manufacturing industry and the maintenance of heavy machinery, to join their team.

WHY SHOULD THIS OPPORTUNITY INTEREST YOU?

  • Unique opportunity to be part of a HUGE industry success
  • Rewards in line with your contribution
  • Opportunity to learn from the best in the industry
  • Competitive compensation
  • Inspiring, hands-on leadership
  • State-of-the-art facilities

 Job Summary and Responsibilities

The incumbent will work under the supervision of the Maintenance Manager and will have as main responsibilities: The maintenance of facilities, equipment and premises, while respecting the Health and Safety program implemented by the company.

Scope of functions 

  • Rigour, excellence in the execution of mechanical tasks
column2:
• Carry out repairs, adjustments and maintenance of various equipment on  different shifts (day, evening, night and weekends).
  • Ensure daily cleanliness of the premises and good practices to maintain the facilities (equipment)
  • In the event of a major breakdown, be able to make an initial diagnosis and establish priorities, undertake the work and, if necessary, communicate with the resource persons according to the analysis of the situation
  • Be able to write a detailed intervention report and propose permanent solutions
  • Carry out inspection routes, when requested
  • Master the work order process
  • Participate in the preventive maintenance program
  • Carry out repairs on components in the workshop
  • Collaborate in the resolution of problems related to the efficiency and improvement of equipment
  • Perform any other related tasks.

    •  

    Job Requirements

    • DEC in Mechanical Engineering OR equivalent diploma
column3: • 3 to 5 years of experience in a plant environment
column4: • Demonstrate rigour in the execution of tasks and the transmission of information
column5: • Be responsible for implementing actions by following a problem-solving process in case of repetitive breakdowns or equipment failure
column6: • Demonstrate a sense of initiative by being responsible for deepening and mastering the required knowledge (be proactive and use all opportunities/time available to favour the acquisition of new knowledge)
column7: • Know and apply all rules, procedures and regulations relating to health and safety
column8: • Be able to identify risks and act effectively in case of emergency
column9:
• Have a toolbox with a minimum of equipment for an industrial application.

Mécanicien agricole recherché dans la région de la Beauce

Vous êtes mécanicien agricole, mécanicien de véhicules lourds ou d'engins de chantier ? Vous souhaitez relever de nouveaux défis ? Vous demeurez en Beauce ou souhaitez vous relocaliser dans le secteur ? Que vous soyez quelqu'un de plus junior à la recherche d'un premier défi ou, à l'inverse, souhaitez pouvoir mettre à contribution votre bagage de connaissances ? Nous avons clairement un emploi parfait pour toi !

POSTE: Mécanicien agricole
HORAIRE: De jour ou de soir
LIEU: Sainte-Marie ou Saint-Georges
SALAIRE: Entre 22$/h et 35$/h

Avantages
Voici les avantages d'occuper de poste de mécanicien en Beauce:

- Possibilité de se développer en tant que professionnel dans le domaine que vous soyez junior ou déjà expérimenté
- Super opportunité de progression à l'interne autant en responsabilités qu'en compétences
- Une entreprise familiale et une excellente ambiance de travail
- Compagnie très bien établie dans la région et à travers le Québec (excellente stabilité d'emploi)

Responsabilités
Voici les tâches associées à ce poste de mécanicien en Beauce (St-Georges ou Sainte-Marie)

- Maintenance des équipements (préventive et corrective)
- Assemblage d'équipements au besoin
- Intervenir sur des équipements mécaniques, hydrauliques, électriques, etc.
- Toutes autres tâches connexes au métier de mécanicien

Qualifications
Avez-vous le bagage nécessaire afin d'occuper cet emploi à Sainte-Marie de Beauce ou St-Georges de Beauce?

Vous avez complété une formation en mécanique agricole, au niveau de la mécanique d'engins de chantier ou de véhicules lourds ? Vous désirez mettre à profit vos connaissances tout en ayant la possibilité de continuer de les développer ? Vous êtes un employé polyvalent et qui aime le travail d'équipe ? Vous êtes motivé à vous établir dans une entreprise reconnue à travers le Québec?

Ce poste est donc fait pour vous!

Antoine
418-576-9863

65,Mechanic - Light Duty (Red Seal),Mikisew Group LP,"Fort McMurray, AB",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/mechanic-light-duty-red-seal-fort-mcmurray-01--6c89476e-7fd6-4eb0-980b-9f930b716c1d?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.37&_ga=2.161913915.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

The Opportunity - FLY IN/FLY OUT, CAMP PROVIDED

MFM LP, a Mikisew Group company, is currently seeking skilled and qualified candidates for the position of Automotive Service Technician (AST)/Light Duty Mechanic to join our operation at Kearl Lake. MFM provides comprehensive Client services in vehicle inspection and light duty repair services.

Duties &
column2:
Responsibilities
  • Perform repair work and routine maintenance on light duty vehicles and equipment,
  • Check light duty equipment such as light duty trucks, vans, cars and support equipment for proper performance and inspect equipment to detect faults and malfunctions.
  • Diagnose faults or malfunctions using computerized and other testing equipment to determine extent of repair required
  • Adjust, repair or replace defective parts, components or systems
  • Complete service reports
  • Other duties as assigned

Working Conditions

Position is at our Kearl Lake facility., located North of Fort McMurray.  The work schedule is 14 days on, 14 days off, 11.5 hours per day.  Work is conducted under an Hours of Work Averaging Arrangement (HWAA) -formerly known as a Compressed Work Week.  This is a Fly In/Fly Out opportunity with camp/accommodations provided.  Airfare travel hubs are Edmonton &
column3:
Calgary, with direct flights to site.  Workers are responsible for travel to/from the travel hubs and their residence.

Qualifications

  • Journeyman Automotive Service Technician (AST), Light Duty Technician Certification
    • Red Seal Certification preferred
  • First Aid Certification preferred
  • 5 years’ experience working in a light duty automotive facility servicing light vehicles and support equipment.
  • Successful candidates are responsible for providing their own general tools.  A tool allowance is provided as part of the compensation package.

About Mikisew Group

Since 1991, Mikisew Group has been a leading oilsands partner specializing in site services, maintenance, logistics and construction. We foster the responsible development of our land’s resources while powering sustainable economic progress in our communities and beyond. Mikisew Group has been recognized for overall business performance and sustained growth with the prestigious Canada’s Best Managed Companies designation. The 2021 Best Managed program award winners are among the best in class of Canadian-owned and managed companies with revenues more than $25 million, demonstrating leadership in the areas of strategy, capabilities and innovation, culture and commitment, and financials to achieve sustainable growth.

line-height:17px"">MELS | Complice de vos projets

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'un(e) mécanicien(ne) pour intégrer notre équipe à St-Hubert!

Votre défi
Assurer l’entretien et la réparation de nos véhicules lourds et veiller à la prévention de bris d’équipements.

Votre quotidien
- Veiller à l’entretien et la réparation de différents équipements tels : moteurs diesel, suspensions, systèmes électriques et systèmes hydrauliques.
- Rechercher la cause des bris et vérifier le fonctionnement des équipements pour déceler les défauts et les défaillances.
- Réparer les bris mécaniques et aviser son supérieur des défectuosités majeures.

Votre profil
- DEP en mécanique de véhicule diesel, en mécanique de véhicule lourd ou l’équivalent
column4: - Deux (2) années d’expérience en mécanique
column5: - Connaissance mécanique général -4500kg auto et +4500kg camion lourd
column6: - Carte PEP, un atout
column7: - Permis de conduire (classe 1 ou 3) ou intérêt à l’obtenir
column8: - Détenir un bon coffre à outils de base
column9: - Bonne capacité d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes
column10: - Autonomie et débrouillardise dans l’exécution du travail
column11: - Dextérité manuelle, minutie et vigilance
column12: - Bonne résistance physique et tolérance au stress
column13:
- Capacité à travailler en équipe.

Faites partie de l’équipe MELS et…
- Travailler sur la rive-sud (St-Hubert)
column14: - Ayez accès à des vêtements et bottes fournis
column15: - Contribuez à votre manière à l'industrie cinématographique et télévisuelle
column16: - Accédez à un?régime complet d’avantages sociaux?compétitifs
column17: - Procurez-vous, au besoin, une semaine de vacances supplémentaires chaque année
column18: - Évoluez dans une entreprise qui se soucie de l’environnement
column19:
- Ayez la possibilité de progresser parmi divers postes à l’interne.

Ça vous parle? Discutons!

MELS est la plus importante entreprise canadienne de services liés au cinéma et à la télévision. Son offre s’étend à l’ensemble des besoins en location de studios de tournage, de caméras et d’éclairage, en effets visuels, DI, en postproduction vidéo et audio, laboratoire photochimique et en restauration d’images, en gestion et production d’éléments pour la distribution et la diffusion sur les réseaux de cinéma, de télévision, d’internet et de téléphonie mobile.

Curieux d’en savoir plus : https://www.mels-studios.com/fr/

https://vimeo.com/397988162
https://vimeo.com/497278079
La personne qui occupera le poste devra se conformer à l’ensemble des politiques de la société notamment celle en matière de vaccination Covid-19 en vigueur le 1er novembre 2021.

Groupe TVA remercie tous les candidats et toutes les candidates de leur intérêt, mais seules les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue seront convoquées à une entrevue. Groupe TVA, qui souscrit aux principes de l'équité en emploi, encourage les personnes qualifiées à poser leur candidature.

69,310T Mechanic,Waste Connections,"Kitchener, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/310t-mechanic-kitchener-08--b8f617de-331e-4007-85a2-f451cb8b1474?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.41&_ga=2.161913915.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"


Waste Connections of Canada has an opening for a Heavy Duty Mechanic to join our team in Kitchener, ON to work on a fleet of garbage trucks. As a Heavy Duty Mechanic, you will do a lot of hydraulics, brake jobs along with preventative maintenance and minor engine repair.




You will be responsible for maintaining Waste Connections of Canada (WCC) vehicles and equipment in a safe working order. The Heavy Duty Mechanic will work directly with the Maintenance Manager to ensure that all vehicles meet all provincial regulations and standards, and WCC safety standards.




Full time with benefits


With OT and bonuses - Mechanics can make up to $80k - $90k per year


Pay rate: $39.10 per hour plus $1.00 shift premium




Location: 139 Ardelt Ave Kitchener, ON


Shift timing: 4 Day work Week Monday-Thursday from 3 pm till 1:00 am, Fridays off




Requirements:

+ 310T license (MANDATORY)

+ 3-4 years of experience as a Heavy Duty Mechanic

+ Must be able to pass all pre-employment tests

+ Commercial Driving License






Come, join a team environment, and colleagues who embrace a ""work hard, play harder"" culture. Our compensation package is competitive and comes with excellent benefits. You’ll also be associating yourself with a company that likes to lead by example through a strong presence in our local communities, charitable giving, sustainability initiatives, and more.




Waste Connections of Canada is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

",[]

70,Mechanic - 310T,York1 Environmental Ltd,"Vaughan, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/mechanic-310t-vaughan-08--860ffb20-45fd-4fa8-b479-9e607accd8ae?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.42&_ga=2.161913915.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
Company Description

York1 Employees, whether they work at one of our project sites or at head office, play an important role in helping us achieve our mission. We provide exceptional services and innovative solutions through our infrastructure and environmental divisions to some of the largest commercial and residential projects across the GTA and Southern Ontario. We are driven by our responsibility to foster excellence and a safe work environment while maintaining productivity and an environmentally responsible workplace. Excellence in the management of our projects is a fundamental corporate responsibility and part of the York1 way of doing business.

Job Description

The Mechanic 310T will be responsible for inspecting, repairing, and maintaining trucks and equipment by coordinating, diagnosing and troubleshooting on a regular basis. The role will be required to manage tools and supplies and ensure the equipment is always in working order.  

Key Functions &
column2:
Duties:

  • Perform routine diagnostics and repairs on equipment using diagnostic tools, hand tools and measuring instruments
  • Responsible for inspecting and performing troubleshooting to diesel engines, hydraulic, electrical, and mechanical systems
  • Operate and test equipment on site and to ensure quality and efficiency standards are met
  • Perform major repairs to engines, electrical and fuel systems when required
  • Create a preventative maintenance schedule to follow and use as a guideline
  • Conduct oil changes, lubrication of equipment and tire replacements on an as need basis
  • Ensure entering of work orders and replacement parts are ordered in a timely manner
  • Create and maintain a timely and detailed service report and repair reports
  • Provide exceptional quality work in a timely fashion

 

Required Qualifications and Skills:

·        3 years of experience as a Truck Mechanic (Construction Industry preferred)

·        Must own your own tools

·        Possesses a valid and up to date driver’s license

·        Understands how to engage with internal and external clients in a customer centric way

·        Strong attention to detail with ability to produce accurate and quality work under tight deadlines and minimal supervision

·        Well organized and able to work accurately and effectively under pressure

·        Possess excellent interpersonal communication skills

Qualifications

  • 3 years of experience as a Truck Mechanic (Construction Industry preferred)
  • Must own your own tools
  • Possesses a valid and up to date driver’s license
  • Understands how to engage with internal and external clients in a customer centric way
  • Strong attention to detail with ability to produce accurate and quality work under tight deadlines and minimal supervision
  • Well organized and able to work accurately and effectively under pressure
  • Possess excellent interpersonal communication skills


Additional Information

https://york1.com/

Why work with York1?

Our employees play an important role in helping us achieve our mission of providing exceptional service and innovative solutions through our infrastructure and environmental services to some of the largest commercial and residential projects across the GTA and Southern Ontario. They are foundation to our success and represent our greatest strength. We focus on investing in our employees through career development programs, training and internal opportunities and advancement. Right here and right now, we are building a culture of success that you can be a part of!

Does this sound like you? Apply Now!

We would like to thank everyone who applies, however only those applicants who are most qualified will be contacted.

72,Mechanic,"Railserve, Inc.","Lanigan, SK",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/mechanic-lanigan-11--8da9df61-b2bb-486c-953d-5645d55945db?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.44&_ga=2.161913915.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

I. SUMMARY 

This position is responsible for maintaining fleet of locomotives to ensure the company s ability to serve the customer and provide reliable equipment for employees.

II. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Performs scheduled and emergency maintenance on all company locomotives in a cost effective manner (including Gen-Set, SW and GP).
  • Troubleshoots and fixes mechanical and electrical problems.
  • Maintain proper records (preventative maintenance sheets, invoices, shipping documents, expense reports).
  • Handle environmental issues in appropriate manner (e.g. proper disposal of filter oil, diesel fuel or other materials.
  • Comply with company safety policies and procedures
column2:
must wear required personal protective equipment.
  • Conducts periodic safety assessments on equipment according to a frequency determined by the Corporate Safety Department.
  • Suggests and /or implements administrative or engineering controls to abate or minimize safety hazards. Implementation will require appropriate approvals.
  • Other duties as assigned.

III. QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

A.     EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE 

  • Associate s degree or equivalent from two year college or technical school preferred
column3:
or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Must have deep mechanical experience, electrical experience preferred.
  • Must have valid Driver s license.
  • Must be able to operate cutting torch and electrical welder.

B.     LANGUAGE SKILLS 

Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.

C.     MATHEMATICAL SKILLS 

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.

D.     REASONING ABILITY 

Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with the typical problems that occur in rail car switching.

E.     PHYSICAL DEMANDS 

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear.  The employee frequently is required to stand
column4: walk
column5: reach with hands and arms
column6: climb or balance
column7:
and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.  The employee is occasionally required to sit and taste or smell.  The employee must occasionally lift and/or move heavy weights.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

F.      WORK ENVIRONMENT 

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to outside weather conditions and may be required to work nights, holidays, and weekends.  The employee is frequently exposed to moving mechanical parts.  The employee is occasionally exposed to high, precarious places
column8: fumes or airborne particles
column9:
and toxic or caustic chemicals.  The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

G.    OTHER REQUIREMENTS

Must be willing and able to travel frequently (up to 80%) to company and/or customer locations to perform work on locomotives.

We are an equal opportunity employer.

If you are looking for a fast-paced, customer-focused environment where you can start your career or grow your skills alongside one of the best teams of mechanics in Atlantic Canada, Peterbilt Atlantic is the place to do it. Peterbilt Atlantic now boasts nine locations across Atlantic Canada and eastern Québec. We offer a state-of-the-art work environment and a comprehensive benefits plan, including pension and healthcare benefits. It’s your opportunity to work alongside a top-notch team in some of the most modern facilities in the region.
 
Benefits 
  • Blue Cross Insurance 
  • RRSP Contributions 
  • Paid time off and vacation
  • Growth opportunities 
  • Paid Training
  • Family owned and operated
  • Long term job security
  • Discounts on products and services
  • Above average industry pay
Technician Specific Benefits
  • Relocation assistance available for qualified candidates
  • In-floor heat at most locations
  • State-of-the-art, brand new facility with multiple service bays and cutting edge technology
  • Multiple bays with lifts
  • Shop equipped with the newest technology and equipment
  • Uniforms provided 
  • Discounts on products and services

  • Career advancement opportunities, promote from within

  • Provide assistance to Service Department for vehicles and equipment.

  • Develop and maintain positive relationships with customers to increase overall customer happiness.

GoWrench Auto is an exciting mobile auto service company that performs automotive repairs and maintenance services for fleets and consumers at the customer's location. Home or work we are there.

Position:

GoWrench Auto is looking for an experienced and licensed technician with the right tools to join our exciting team! Full time.

Responsibilities:

  • Do what you do best. Diagnose and repair approved services on customer vehicles.
  • Advise on all work performed after each service, vehicle conditions and recommendations
  • Always work in a clean and safe manner
  • Be friendly and personable and answer customer questions

Qualifications:

  • Must be a Licensed Automotive Service Technician 310S with 5+ years of experience
  • Must have their own tools
  • Ability to keep up to date with changing technology
  • Must be committed to providing an amazing customer experience


GoWrench Auto offers:

At GoWrench Auto, mechanics are a valued member of our team. Being part of our team will bring the following:

  • Highest wage in the Industry- between $40-70 per hour based on experience and applicant
  • Semi-flexible schedule - We operate 7 days per week. Need a day off or want to make more? Pick up weekend days!
  • Guaranteed Hours
  • Industry-leading bonus program for superior performance.
  • The opportunity for growth into leadership positions

75,B MECHANIC,Bowlero Corp,"BRAMPTON, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/b-mechanic-brampton-08--998d1464-0e23-4bc8-b4d1-255e61894bb6?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.47&_ga=2.161913915.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
Overview:

SUMMARY:     Repairs and maintains automatic Pinspotters / Pinsetters, lane and scoring equipment, building and all other bowling center equipment at the highest level of operating proficiency.   Assists in the repair and maintenance of the bowling facility.   Performs preventive maintenance, cleaning and /or minor repairs as directed by the center Facility Manager.

 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:  Primary duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following.

  • Maintains Pinspotters/Pinsetters and related bowling equipment to Bowlero Corporation specifications as directed.
  • Abides by and maintains safety procedures and operation procedures as required by Bowlero Corporation and OSHA.
  • Ensures that shop and machine area are clean and organized at all times.
  • Assists the center Facility Manager with the training of new mechanics.
  • Follows the preventive maintenance program for all center equipment (daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annually).
  • Monitors and maintains clean, consistent and scoreable lane conditions to USBC specifications were required.
  • Maintains lane conditioning equipment.
  • Monitors and performs daily center maintenance on HVAC, roofing, plumbing and electrical as instructed by Facility Manager/General Manager after proper training.
  • Quickly and safely corrects pin jams, ball return calls, and other malfunctions while bowling is in progress.
  • Assists in performing both general and emergency maintenance repairs as directed by the supervisor on duty.
  • Maintains and keeps up to date all necessary logs and frames per stop sheets.
  • Must complete the B- Mechanic training programs within specified time frame.
  • Ability to work varying shifts, weekends and holidays, as well as, extended workdays to support business needs.
  • Other duties may be assigned.

 

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:   n/a

 

QUALIFICATIONS: B-Mechanics must possess the ability to read, analyze, and interpret common technical manuals and schematics.   Responds to common inquiries or complaints from employees, customers and/or regulatory agencies.   Effectively communicates pertinent information to center management.   Applies principles of logical thinking to a wide range of practical problems.   Deals with nonverbal schematics (formulas, schematics, graphs, etc.) and a variety of abstract and concrete variables.

 

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE: High School Diploma or equivalent with algebra, geometry and/or applied mathematics and three to five years of related experience.   Relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and experience is also acceptable.

 

WORK ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Bowling center environment where you will walk, bend and stand for periods of time, and may be asked to lift up to 30lbs often, team lift up to 100lbs occasionally. The noise level is typical for bowling.

The 401 Group of Companies, is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's fastest growing dealer groups offering a full line of automotive, recreational vehicle, powersport and marine products and services. Our brands include but aren't limited to Kia, Mitsubishi, Volkswagen, Hyundai, Yamaha, 401 Auto Financing, CampMart and Grand River Boats. If you have a growth mindset like us, we'd love to see your resume and have a conversation. The opportunities at the 401 Group of Companies are endless!

Wage: $40 flat rate

  • Completing preventative maintenance such as, engine tune-ups, oil changes, tire rotation and changes, wheel balancing, replacing filters.

Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic, Day Shift
This is an exciting opportunity to work with a well known, growing leader of the Construction Industry, servicing SW Ontario. Amazing Overtime opportunities!

Currently seeking a reliable Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic to keep all equipment running at full capacity, this opportunity will include inspecting and diagnosing all components and equipment required for servicing needs.
In addition to rebuilding and repairing heavy duty construction equipment as required, the completion of associated service paperwork and updating and maintaining of all service records is required.
Equipment includes a full range of construction equipment and heavy machinery including dump trucks, excavators, tractors, and more.
This opportunity will work both in a shop setting, as well as on service calls.

  • Verify and repair emission control, hydraulic, and electrical systems
  • Use hand tools, power tools, welding equipment, cutting torches and measuring instruments
  • Perform quality checks according to procedure
  • Ensure that all equipment is continually maintained at the highest standards

column1: 78,"Aircraft Maintenance Engineer, Apprentice - YPA",Rise Air,"Prince Albert, SK",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/aircraft-maintenance-engineer-apprentice-ypa-prince-albert-11--3a98f575-8022-4ee9-8754-f75a568950bf?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.50&_ga=2.161913915.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
column3: line-height:normal"">Full Time
column4:
line-height:normal"">Prince Albert SK


Rise Air is western Canada's largest full-service aviation operation. Based in Prince Albert, here is your opportunity to work in the fascinating aviation industry for a dynamic company that exceeds customers' expectations, strives for operational excellence, and has a strong employee culture.

Job Purpose

Under the direction of the Base Engineer, this position is responsible for completing the day-to-day maintenance activities on our fleet of fixed-wing aircraft in accordance with Transport Canada approved standards. The aircraft maintenance engineer apprentice will complete all tasks required to obtain their Aircraft Maintenance Engineer License.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Complete each task and associated maintenance documentation in an appropriate, safe, and timely manner.
  • Maintain close communication with senior maintenance personnel to ensure that mandated job processes and methodologies are understood and adhered to.
  • Report any defect that is noted while performing maintenance tasks.
  • Ensure that all components installed on aircraft are pre-approved and properly certified.
  • Accurately account for all completed maintenance tasks by maintaining an up-to-date logbook.
  • Assist in keeping the maintenance office, hangar, and shop areas clean and ensure equipment is appropriately stored/returned after tasks are completed.
  • Attend training courses as approved and required.
column5: background:#ffffff"">Qualifications
column6:
background:#ffffff"">Typically, the knowledge and skills required for this position include a high school diploma or equivalent, and the successful completion of a diploma in Aircraft Maintenance from a Transport Canada-approved educational institution. Knowledge and understanding of Canadian Aviation Regulations and previous experience working in an aviation environment is considered an asset.

Skills, knowledge, and abilities include:

  • Ability to hold and maintain a class 5 valid driver's license.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Sound problem solving, decision-making, analytical thinking, planning, prioritization, and execution skills.
  • Ability to take initiative and ownership of projects and tasks and execute effectively and in a timely manner.

As this is a Safety Sensitive Position, selected candidate(s) must test negative for impairing substances and alcohol prior to employment.

79,Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (CAT 01),Air Canada,"VANCOUVER, BC",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/aircraft-maintenance-engineer-cat-01-vancouver-02--cc9d3076-c37c-4465-9976-60520d70a4d8?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.51&_ga=2.161913915.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.

Air Canada is presently looking for dynamic individuals to fill the permanent full-time positions of Aircraft Technicians or Aircraft Maintenance Engineers at our Vancouver Maintenance Centre.
The position is located near the Vancouver International Airport. The current salary starts at %2431.50/hour, based on experience and according to the Collective Agreement.

Aircraft Technicians / Aircraft Maintenance Engineers are responsible for airframe maintenance and should have the following skill sets:
• Ability to use the correct tools, methods, techniques and equipment required to perform aircraft maintenance.
• Candidates should be able to read and understand various schematic diagrams for maintenance troubleshooting and be proficient with computers and diagnostic tools.
• Individuals need to be ""team players"" with excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to maintain a customer focused attitude in a demanding, high stress environment.
Please take 2 minutes to watch the following video with more information about the Aircraft Technician/Aircraft Maintenance Engineer role:httpss://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cuwqi8PokME

  • Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Required as of October 31st 2021
  • High School diploma.
  • You must have completed a recognized apprenticeship program, and/or have a least 4 years industry related experience.
  • Possession of a Transport Canada AME M2 or M1 license (Mandatory)
  • Possession of valid driver's license (Mandatory)
  • Able to successfully pass the pre-employment qualifying exam, physical and a security check.
  • Be available to work night, evenings and days including weekends and holidays.
  • Night shift is the permanent position for this posting. Possibility to change with seniority.
  • Be available to work night, evenings and days including weekends and holidays.
  • Eligible to work in Canada.
  • Ability to Pass and obtain an airside vehicle operator’s permit (Mandatory)
  • Possession of a restricted radio operators permit (aviation).
  • Ability to pass security clearance and obtain the Restricted area identity card (RAIC). Please refer to Transport Canada site for more details.
  • Employees in this role, conduct safety-critical work and as such, Air Canada medical standards must be met in order to qualify for the role. Candidates will be subject to a medical evaluation, including a drug and alcohol test and are expected to be free of any intoxicating substances.
  • Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibly of the candidates applying for this position.

Assets

  • Endorsements on Air Canada aircraft type.
  • Current security clearance.

Linguistic Requirements

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.

Diversity and Inclusion


Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.


As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest

column3: background:#ffffff"">Join our Vancouver team!
column4: line-height:115%
column5:
background:#ffffff"">Pacific Coastal Airlines is looking for a permanent full-time Aircraft Maintenance Engineer Category ""M"".This position is based out of a hangar located near the South Terminal building at the Vancouver International Airport in Richmond.

Aircraft Maintenance Engineer - Category ""M"" role requires adherence to the highest level of safety standards and the ability to follow policies and execute procedures, utilizing skill and knowledge, to identify and prioritize operational problem areas. The successful candidate must ensure proper paperwork is in order and submitted in a timely manner, meaning all certification and recertifications must be recorded prior to releasing aircraft into service. He/she must also stay current on Company Maintenance Control Manuals and other industry-related manuals/material.

Qualifications:

  • Valid Transport Canada AME license - category M1 and M2
  • Experience working on SAAB 340 and Beech 1900 is a strong asset
  • The ability to obtain and maintain a RAIC and an AVOP
  • Ability to travel as required
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to work well in a team environment

WHY PACIFIC COASTAL AIRLINES?

Company Culture: We honour our company motto of People Friendly, People First for both our employees and our passengers. We encourage a positive, caring workplace and put a high value on collaboration, accountability, and loyalty. We are inclusive, respectful, and have a friendly corporate culture.

Compensation: We recognize and value industry experience by offering competitive compensation commensurate with prior experience as well as a company-match Group RRSP to assist with retirement planning.

Health Benefits: We offer a standard benefits package consisting of health, dental, vision, travel medical, life insurance, AD&
column6:
D, short-term disability, long-term disability, an employee and family assistance program, paid sick days, and paid personal emergency days.

Travel Benefits: We offer excellent travel perks within the Pacific Coastal network for employees, their families, and their buddies. Also available to employees and their eligible family members is standby travel on many other airlines across the world. Additionally, employees are eligible for corporate discounts with various hotels and restaurants within the communities we serve as well as steeply discounted cargo shipping within the Pacific Coastal Airlines network.

Employee Programs: We have employee recognition and reward programs, a milestone service recognition program and employee appreciation events throughout the year.

column2:
margin-bottom:11px"">With a rich heritage and an outstanding portfolio of iconic aircraft, De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. is set to lead the aviation sector of the future.  The De Havilland EAF program (Longview Aviation Services Inc.), established in 2018, is focused on creating an ""Enhanced Aerial Firefighter"".   The program involves taking selected CL-215 aerial firefighting aircraft and combining the proven performance of existing airframe(s) with modern upgrades - All in an effort to create the next generation of the world’s only purpose-built aerial firefighter and multi-mission amphibious platform, the CL-415 EAF.

Responsibilities:

  • Install, rig and carry out mechanical and structural functions and testing in accordance with the manufacturer's specifications
  • Disassemble, inspect, record discrepancies as well as recommend and record methods of repair
  • Repair and fabricate parts and components
  • Ensure that all applicable airworthiness requirements are met
  • Ensure both accuracy and traceability of parts removed or installed on the Aircraft
  • Follow the policies and procedures laid out in the Company's Transport Canada Approved Maintenance Policy Manual to ensure the Company is in full compliance with the current Canadian Aviation Regulations
  • For those AME's possessing certifying authority, perform and/or certify work performed within the scope of this Aircraft Maintenance Organization
  • Maintain a clean work area, and alert the Supervisor of any safety concerns
  • Perform any other work assigned

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • 2+ years experience working on CL 415/215T/215 aircraft and CL 415/215T/215 systems
  • 5+ years experience with general aircraft repair, fabrication and installation
  • Valid AME “M1” or “M2” Transport Canada License
column3: M2 is preferred or be eligible to be an apprentice to achieve this license","['5+ years experience with general aircraft repair, fabrication and installation', 'Ensure both accuracy and traceability of parts removed or installed on the Aircraft', 'EXPERIENCE AND\xa0EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:', 'Perform any other work assigned', 'Disassemble, inspect, record discrepancies as well as recommend and record methods of repair', 'Ensure that all applicable airworthiness requirements are met', 'Valid AME “M1” or “M2” Transport Canada License

SKYSERVICE BUSINESS AVIATION

Skyservice is a North American leader in business aviation. Built on the key principles of safety and service excellence, we provide a full service experience from Aircraft Management, Aircraft Charter, Maintenance and Aircraft sales from our Fixed Base Operations that span Canada and the western United States. People and values are the inseparable assets that drive our dedication to Quality, Safety, Respect, Commitment and Efficiency. These are the core values that guide us every day and help build our reputation as leaders in aviation services. Skyservice is a team dedicated to supporting and developing our employees. If you want to grow your career and broaden your experience, then Skyservice is the right team for you.

REPORTS TO:  Manager, Maintenance YQA

SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Developing your skills as an apprentice by performing and ensuring proper completion of all maintenance activities related to Sky Regionalaircrafts, with the support of experienced AMEs

84,Aircraft Interior Installation Technician - Peterborough Location,Flying Colours Corp - FCCN,"Peterborough, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/aircraft-interior-installation-technician-peterborough-location-peterborough-08--656f2fca-5698-4780-8b76-6ef1073623b4?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.56&_ga=2.153515199.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

Flying Colours Corp is a global leader in all aspects of aircraft completions and maintenance. With facilities in Canada, USA, and Singapore our continued growth and success is driven by our talented workforce that embody our core values: integrity, innovation and flexibility.

Due to continued growth in our businesses, we have a requirement for an Aircraft Interior Installation Technician to join our Team at our Peterborough, Ontario location.


General Accountability
column2: line-height:115%"">Responsible for safely and efficiently install all seats, sidewalls, TV's, appliances, galleys, lavatories, etc., into refurbished or green completion aircrafts in accordance with the instruction of the Crew Leader, as well as, any/all governing body's regulations. Additional responsibilities also include aircraft interior disassembly, modification, and assessing repairs, removals, and installations.
column3: line-height:115%"">Specific Accountabilities
column4: line-height:16pt"">Removal, disassembly, cleaning, inspection, repair, modification, refurbishment, and installation of aircraft interior and its associated components (seats, carpets, interior paneling, windows, galley, lavatory modules, insulation and sound proofing systems).
column5: line-height:16pt"">Maintain oxygen, water, waste, entertainment systems, emergency systems and equipment.
column6: line-height:16pt"">Work both in an aircraft and in a shop.
column7: line-height:16pt"">Familiar with the function, operation and safety requirements of aircraft passenger support systems.
column8: line-height:16pt"">Review and understand all necessary documentation (drawings, work scope, task cards/snags), to perform task(s).
column9: line-height:16pt"">Understand FCC expectations and which specific area(s) require rework.
column10: line-height:16pt"">Responsible for providing progress report on assigned tasks, discrepancies (any variable that will negatively affect the quality &amp
column11: timing of task(s) and recommendations
column12: line-height:16pt"">Inform Crew Leader of any necessary tools, equipment and supplies needed to perform task(s) (including items from stores).
column13: line-height:16pt"">Completely fill out timecards daily by making sure that the snag/task card information is correct.
column14: line-height:16pt"">Complete task cards as soon as task is completed (within 24 hours unless drawing/specification is not available).
column15: line-height:16pt"">Perform work in a productive, diligent, careful and safe manner.
column16: line-height:16pt"">Complete any special projects or other tasks as required or assigned. May be assigned to other areas of operations, based on business or customer requirements.
column17: line-height:16pt"">Any other job-related duties assigned by Crew Leader/Supervisor/Manager.
column19: line-height:16pt"">Secondary school diploma required and/or completion of College/CEGEP/technical training in a related field preferred.
column20: line-height:16pt"">Minimum one year of transferable skills (through assembly, manufacturing, construction, installation).
column21: line-height:16pt"">Experience in an aviation-related field is preferable.
column23: line-height:16pt"">High attention to detail for the purposes of appearance, ergonomics, and safety.
column24: line-height:16pt"">Proven technical and mathematical aptitude.
column25: line-height:16pt"">Ability to read and interpret mechanical/engineering drawings and technical instructions.
column26: line-height:16pt"">Ability to operate a variety of hand and power tools, safely and with care and precision, are essential
column27: line-height:16pt"">Ability to understand and follow direction with minimal supervision.
column28: line-height:16pt"">Proven ability to communicate effectively orally and written.
column29: line-height:16pt"">Ability to trouble-shoot and problem solve.
column30: line-height:16pt"">Positive attitude and willingness to learn.
column31: line-height:16pt"">Self-motivated and able to maintain a rapid pace.
column32:
line-height:16pt"">Ability to work independently and in a team environment.

Working Conditions
column33: line-height:16pt"">Regular periods during which physical effort is required, e.g., walking standing, stooping, climbing, lifting material or equipment, some of which may be heavy or awkward (up to 50lbs)
column34: line-height:16pt"">Exposure to factors such as temperature variations/extremes, fumes, moving machinery, humidity, and materials which can cause periods of discomfort.
column35: line-height:16pt"">Occasional / frequent need to give concentrated attention, with one or two senses at a time, where stimuli are changing.
column36: line-height:16pt"">Occasional indirect and direct pressure from deadlines, production quotas, accuracy or similar demands.
column37:
line-height:16pt"">Work in confined spaces and elevated heights when required.

Working Hours

This is a full-time (FT) position where hours will change due to business operational needs and flexibility is required. The rotational shift is 2 weeks on days then 2 weeks on afternoons.
column43:
font-weight:400"">Afternoon Shift: 3pm to 12am

Compensation

We offer competitive compensation to qualified and highly motivated candidates. Please note that applicants for these positions must have current status to work in Canada in order to be considered for this opportunity.


While we appreciate all resumes received,we can only contact directly those applicants under consideration for interview.


Flying Colours Corp. is proud to participate in the Legislated Employment Equity Program (LEEP). We welcome applications from all qualified candidates including candidates representing the four designated groups: Women, member of Visible Minorities, Aboriginal Peoples and Persons with Disabilities.

column2: margin-right:0cm"">If you like working in the field where the action begins, ensuring that equipment and machinery operate at their optimal level, then keep reading, this role is for you!

column4: text-align:justify"">We are seeking a mechanic in Valleyview, AB. Our industry is horticulture and agriculture, but you may better know us by some of our brands such as: Pro-Mix, C-I-L, Wilson and Alaskan.
column5: margin-right:0cm
column6:
text-align:justify"">Working as a mechanic with Premier Tech means that you will:

  • Coordinate and undertake the repair and preventative maintenance program for the harvest and mobile equipment.
  • Troubleshoot and maintain power transmissions, vacuum, hydraulic, and pneumatic systems, with the added talents of fabrication and welding.
  • Provide important feedback while assessing and diagnosing issues, providing recommendations and completing the approved work orders within the established timelines.
  • Move or operate harvest equipment, as required.
  • And of course, work safely every day by keeping the safety of yourself and others at the forefront!
column7: margin-right:0cm
column8:
text-align:justify"">Is this role for YOU?

  • You are a team player who places a high value on safety.
  • You have earned your heavy equipment technician ticket. If you are working towards it, a combination of experience and a journeyman ticket in a similar trade may be considered.
  • Being resourceful with a strong mechanical aptitude are some of your strengths.
  • You have experience with working in various weather conditions and can easily adapt.
  • The concept of having the equipment ready to maximize efficiency and production are some of your main goals.
  • You have the capacity to work independently and can multitask within a fast-paced environment.
  • You are available for overtime shifts, as required.

column1:
86,Mécanicien (Réparateur de wagons),Canadian National Railway Company,"Toronto, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/m%C3%A9canicien-r%C3%A9parateur-de-wagons-toronto-08--e801e4c7-d018-4864-a295-dfe87ac7bfb2?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.58&_ga=2.153515199.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

Le CN offre de nombreuses possibilités pour les travailleurs de métiers spécialisés qui aiment apprendre constamment et souhaitent faire carrière dans une équipe axée sur la sécurité. Vous travaillerez sur équipements à la fine pointe de la technologie et des wagons de train qui transportent des marchandises du Pacifique à l’Atlantique et jusqu’au golfe du Mexique. Vous serez fiers de votre travail, car vous saurez que vous contribuez à la santé de l’économie. Vous pourrez également améliorer vos compétences grâce à la formation rémunérée. Nous offrons des carrières valorisantes car notre travail fait une différence. Embarquez avec nous!

Résumé des fonctions

Le mécanicien ou la mécanicienne Matériel remorque inspecte, entretient, construit et répare des wagons et du matériel ferroviaire conformément à la réglementation fédérale et aux règles du CN. La personne titulaire du poste est considérée comme étant un apprenti mécanicien ou une apprentie mécanicienne jusqu’à ce que cette personne obtienne le titre de compagnon mécanicien ou de compagne mécanicienne Matériel remorque (consulter la description de la formation ci-dessous).

Principales responsabilités

  • Inspecter les wagons et leurs composants conformément aux règles des associations ferroviaires et de la Federal Railway Administration ainsi qu’aux normes d’exploitation de la Compagnie
  • Effectuer toutes les interventions d’entretien programmées, ponctuelles et préventives et les réparations sur les wagons, le châssis, la charpente, les dispositifs de sécurité, l’appareil de choc et de traction, y compris les essais connexes
  • Réparer et installer des pièces de wagon comme des compresseurs, des valves pneumatiques, des paliers et roulements, des attelages ainsi que des cylindres pneumatiques et des conduits
  • Utiliser des outils à main, des outils à moteur, du matériel de soudage, des chalumeaux oxyacétyléniques et des instruments de mesure
  • Conduire des véhicules de transport, y compris des grues, des camions, des locotracteurs et autre matériel d’atelier.
  • Rédiger des rapports d’inspection, d’entretien et de travaux, et consigner les détails sur les imprimés prévus, conformément aux directives en vigueur

Conditions de travail

  • Travail par quarts, les fins de semaine et les jours fériés, et heures supplémentaires occasionnelles au besoin
  • Travail effectué en partie à l’extérieur dans diverses conditions météorologiques et environnementales
  • Tâches exigeant souvent de se pencher, de se plier, de s’accroupir, de s’agenouiller et de travailler au-dessus de sa tête
column2:
de soulever et de transporter une charge pesant jusqu’à 22 kg (50 livres), et parfois même jusqu’à 39 kg (85 livres)
  • Capacité à monter dans des échelles ou à se tenir en équilibre, ainsi que de tenir des objets
column3:
bonne coordination œil-main
  • Possibilité de devoir travailler loin de son terminal désigné

    • Exigences

    • Expérience acquise en soudage dans le cadre d’une formation officielle ou d’un travail
    • Diplôme d’études secondaires ou l’équivalent
    • Avoir au moins 18 ans
    • Obligation de répondre à toutes les exigences d’évaluation de l’aptitude au travail pour le poste ainsi qu’à toutes les exigences en matière de sécurité
    • Permis de conduire en règle
    • Capacité à travailler de façon autonome, à s’adapter à des conditions changeantes et à bien gérer le stress
    • Capacité à travailler en équipe et à entretenir des relations positives avec les autres
    • Bonne compréhension orale et écrite et bonnes aptitudes en rédaction
    • Empressement à bien faire son travail tout en respectant les normes de qualité et de sécurité et en assurant la satisfaction du client
    • Connaissance des outils et des instruments électriques et électroniques
    • Capacité à déterminer l’état des objets ou des pièces en ce qui a trait à l’usure ou aux avaries
    • Formation professionnelle ou technique et connaissance des règles d’exploitation ferroviaire
    • Connaissance de base des outils informatiques

    Formation

    La personne titulaire du poste reçoit une formation pratique comportant des cours tant théoriques que pratiques, sur une période de 3 semaines à raison de 40 heures par semaine. Selon son degré d’expérience, la personne qui occupe ce poste peut être tenue de suivre un programme d’apprentissage de 4 années de pratique spécifique par CN et de participer à une série de cours à son lieu de travail au Canada. La formation comprend les éléments constitutifs du matériel roulant, l’inspection des wagons, les essais de frein sur véhicule individuel, les marchandises spéciales de niveau 2, la réparation de wagons marchandises, les méthodes de levage des wagons, le soudage en milieu ferroviaire, les nacelles élévatrices, les règles d’exploitation en triage et d’autres éléments pertinents pour le poste. La réussite de cette formation est essentielle à l’exécution des futures tâches. 

    Ce poste est syndiqué. Par conséquent, le salaire et les avantages sociaux sont régis par la convention collective en vigueur.

    À propos du CN 

    En tant que chef de file dans les domaines du transport et de la logistique en Amérique du Nord, nous sommes un véritable pilier de l’économie. Forts d’une équipe d’environ 25 000 cheminots, nous avons pour priorité de faire progresser notre entreprise et l’économie. Nous transportons annuellement des marchandises d’une valeur de 200 G$ US pour un large éventail de secteurs, tels les ressources naturelles, les produits manufacturés et les biens de consommation, sur un réseau de 20 000 milles qui couvre le Canada et le centre des États-Unis. Le CN est la seule entreprise canadienne à figurer dans la catégorie du secteur du transport et de l’infrastructure du transport du Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) World. Créé en 1999, l’indice DJSI World est l’indice de référence en ce qui a trait au développement durable. Au CN, nous travaillons comme UNE ÉQUIPE axée sur la sécurité et nos clients, offrant l’excellence sur le plan de l’exploitation et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement pour produire des résultats.  

    Le CN exige que tous lesmembres de son personnel soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 etqu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat devaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales enpropriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents etfournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN auCanada.

    La forme grammaticale utilisée dans ce document vaut tant pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Le CN souscrit au principe de l’équité en emploi et invite toutes les personnes qualifiées à présenter leur candidature. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt
column4:
cependant, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue. Veuillez consulter régulièrement vos courriels, car les communications sont surtout envoyées par courrier électronique.
