87,310S 310T Mechanic Kitchener,Voyago,"Kitchener, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/310s-310t-mechanic-kitchener-kitchener-08--8fab4194-dbf6-45c0-b485-b5832a336e7d?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.59&_ga=2.153515199.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

We Are The Employer Brand of Choice. It is our mission to be your best choice when seeking a career in Transportation. We believe in creating lasting relationships with our employees, one built on Trust and Respect.

And our employees would agree, having selected us as a Great Place To Work through the annual survey measuring Employee attitudes at Voyago.

Here’s a look at what makes us A Great Place To Work:

84% Agreed “Voyago is a physically safe place to work…”

80% Agreed “I can be myself at Voyago…”

81% Agreed “Management has kept me well-informed…”

A Great Place To Work Certification means that we take your happiness seriously, and we work hard to ensure you are highly engaged and informed on important topics that keep Voyago on the move.

Help shape the future of mobility. Voyago is currently recruiting for a 310S or 310T Mechanic in Kitchener.

Voyago is Ontario’s Leading Mobility company, a subsidiary of Transdev. We’re hiring dynamic, high achievers looking to be Difference Makers within the industry. Voyago continues to advance across Ontario with our multi-model platform covering a variety of segments including Medical Transportation, Student Transportation, and the Public sector with Medium/Micro Rural and Urban Transit, Accessible Needs Para-Transit, and On Demand Mobility.

Our employee success is built on our commitment and emphasis on training and orientation process. Voyago prides itself on the growth of our employees by supporting and encouraging them to develop skills that lead to successful careers.

Voyago believes in the strength of our people and remains committed to our Golden Values statement reflecting our promise of performance to our employees, customers, and communities in which we operate.

Our teams are continuously recognized as top performers in Safety and Client Satisfaction awards. Voyago is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Safest Employers and a recipient of the Excellence Award for several years.

We are People and Safety First. So come join us and help shape the future of mobility at a Great Place To Work company.

Position Overview

Reporting directly to the Fleet Manager and Shop Manager, the Service Technician is responsible for evaluating and ensuring vehicle safety through preventative maintenance as required and all in compliance with all Ministry of Transportation (MTO) and Voyago's guidelines. Utilize parts from inventory or order parts necessary through the Fleet Management software to make repairs. Complete repairs in a timely manner. Service vehicles in accordance with corporate policies and procedures. Keep work environment clean and tidy. Complete required reports as directed (i.e. sign-off on driver initiated repair logs and log books, and PM service logs by division).

Knowledge and Skill Requirements

The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications that include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Possess a minimum 310S/ 310T
  • ODP certification with A/C experience.
  • Have experience and working knowledge of light duty diesel repair, as well as gasoline.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills and sound organizational competencies.
  • Demonstrated leadership, problem-solving, and team-building skills.
  • Excellent proven customer service experience.
  • Valid G class driving license.
  • Possess clean driving record and provide a copy for personal file.


Why work for us?

  • $ 500.00 Annual tool allowance
  • $125.00 boot allowance
  • Uniforms and Winter Jackets provided and laundered on site
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
  • Competitive Benefit Offering
  • Rewarding career with a growing company
  • Great company culture
  • Award Winning
  • Focus on Innovation and Sustainable Environmental Initiatives
  • Subsidiary of Global Transportation Provider (Transdev)

Sounds interesting? Please send your resume and salary expectations directly to Soha Khalaf, Recruitment Specialist at soha.khalaf@voyago.ca.

Voyago is committed to provide accommodation for individuals with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. Accommodations are available upon request of the internal or external applicant. If you require an accommodation due to a disability for an interview, please notify Human Resources directly to make appropriate arrangements when contacted for an interview.

We thank all applicants however only those under consideration will be contacted.

88,Mechanic,Regional Municipality of Peel,"Brampton, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/mechanic-brampton-08--7e6950be-c772-49be-b6c6-b6a73d7147c2?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.60&_ga=2.153515199.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

Job Description

Mechanic 

Public Works – Operations Support

Contract Full-Time - Twelve (12) Months

CUPE Local 966

 

Reporting to the Foreperson Fleet Services you will perform repairs and maintenance of Regional cars, dump trucks, snow clearing and construction equipment, and small engines and ambulances.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Plan and schedule duties according to work priorities and requirements as directed
  • Diagnose and repair vehicles and equipment
  • Perform scheduled preventative maintenance and annual safety inspections as required
  • Ensure work is performed safely, efficiently within the time allotted and in accordance with legislated standards
  • Install and repair specialized vehicle accessories and safety equipment
  • Order and receive replacement or repair parts as directed and keep stock area in neat and tidy condition
  • Supply and use own hand tools to carry out maintenance and repair duties
  • Accurately complete forms, reports and input/retrieve information into Fleet Management System
  • Execute duties in a tactful manner and maintain a neat appearance to portray a positive image of the Region of Peel
  • Will be required to perform emergency roadside repairs
  • Attend training courses as required

Qualifications:

  • Must hold a current Province of Ontario Motor Vehicle License 310T and 310S preferably with Propane Fuel Tech (P) via TSSA
  • Must hold Ontario Vehicle Operator’s Permit Class “G” in good standing
  • Minimum grade 12 education or equivalent
  • Must be able to read, write and understand English
  • Must be able to complete various work forms and prepare simple written reports
  • Experience, preferably in Fleet Maintenance environment dealing with a variety of light and heavy vehicles and up to date on automotive electronics
  • Experience with diagnostic equipment, ie: scanners, digital meters, tire balancers, brake lathes, and AC filling and testing equipment 

Preference will be given to qualified applicants who are currently in the bargaining unit

 

Location: 2 Copper Road, Brampton, ON

Hours of Work: 40 hours per weeo

Interview: Our recruitment process will be completed with video conference technology. 

 

If this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.

 

As part of the Region’s ongoing commitment to health and safety, there are enhanced Covid-19 specific safety protocols and/or personal protective equipment requirements (e.g. masks, eye protection, etc.) in place to help protect health and safety. The additional requirements are determined based on the nature of the work being carried out.

 

New employees who commence employment on or after October 1, 2021 are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Being fully vaccinated is determined as the status of having received the full series of approved vaccines (both doses of a two dose vaccine series, one dose of a single dose vaccine series) and any additional doses required and approved by Health Canada and having satisfied the full post vaccination period required to ensure vaccination efficacy. The Region of Peel reserves the right to request proof of vaccination at any time. Acceptable proof includes an Ontario Ministry of Health COVID-19 vaccine receipt which you can obtain through the Provincial portal https://covid19.ontariohealth.ca/, or other government-issued vaccine passport or certification.

 

The requirement to be fully vaccinated is subject to the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you are not fully vaccinated, a documented medical reason provided by a physician or registered nurse and time period for the medical reason may be accepted.

About Us

The Region of Peel serves more than 1.4 million residents and approximately 173,000 businesses in Brampton, Caledon and Mississauga. We deliver a wide range of resident focused services across the Region.

Our 20-year vision for Peel is “Community for Life.” Our goal is to create a place where everyone enjoys a sense of belonging and has access to the services and opportunities needed to thrive in each stage of their lives. Our 2015-2035 Strategic Plan outlines the work we're focused on to bring this vision to life.

To learn more about the Region of Peel, explore peelregion.ca.

Additional Information

The Region of Peel is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is respected and valued for their contributions, and where everyone is treated fairly and has opportunity to grow and develop. As one of the most diverse regions in Canada, we are committed to establishing a qualified workforce that is reflective of the population we serve.

 

The Region of Peel is committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process, upon request.  If you require accommodation please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. Accessible formats and communication supports are available. Please contact zzg-hrtalentacquisition@peelregion.ca.  We encourage applications from all qualified individuals
column2:
however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

 

Please be advised, the Region of Peel uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicant’s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the position and your application will be removed from the competition.

Great company. Great people. Great opportunities.

As a Service Tech IV – Customer Equipment Services (CES) at United Rentals, you’ll use your skills to perform maintenance and repairs of complex equipment on customer owned equipment with limited or no supervision in a highly skilled, safe, and professional manner. Every day, you can improve and challenge yourself, and if you have the desire and ambition, you’ll have the potential to work towards leadership roles in our Service Department. Like every member of our team, we will rely on you to provide exceptional customer service to our customers.

If you would enjoy the chance to make your mark with the world’s largest equipment rental provider, consider a future with United Rentals. You will be supported by a strong management team that will help you achieve your goals. Plus, you will have the opportunity to relocate to one of our 1,000+ locations.

  • Maintenance and repair of complex mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and diesel systems on a variety of rental and customer equipment and tools while using a high degree of independent judgment

90,Mechanic,Forbes Bros Ltd.,"Saskatoon, SK",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/mechanic-saskatoon-11--7ecf0204-021d-4f2e-ad9f-cd9486b51bee?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.62&_ga=2.153515199.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

To support operational growth, Forbes Bros is looking for a Commercial Transport or Heavy Equipment Mechanic to join our team. Reporting to the Fleet Maintenance Lead, the Mechanic maintains, repairs and overhauls heavy vehicles and industrial equipment at our Prince Albert, Saskatchewan location.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform preventative and corrective maintenance of all systems associated with work equipment (mechanical, electrical, pneumatic, and hydraulic)
  • When required performs field service calls
  • Evaluate parts for reuse, repair, or replacement
  • Confer on a regular basis with Manager on any operational deficiencies
  • Use various hand and power hand tools. Candidate must supply metric and std hand tools up to 1 1/2"" (38mm) socket and wrench size and chest that is suitably equipped for general mechanical work in a heavy fleet shop.
  • Operates equipment such as overhead or mobile cranes and forklifts to assist in assignments
  • Diagnose equipment problems and take corrective action to minimize the impact on crew production
  • Adapts to new methods, processes, material, and equipment
  • Prepare and submit equipment maintenance records, time sheets, etc.
  • Follows prescribed safety procedures including the use of safety clothing and equipment
  • Ensures cleanliness and organization of shop, maintenance of shop tools and equipment, loading/unloading and storage of equipment, including service trucks
  • Working on heavy duty and on road equipment such as excavators, wheel Loaders, backhoes, digger derrick trucks, aerial bucket trucks, trailers, and dump trucks
  • Assists other Technicians as needed

Requirements:

  • Self-directed, outgoing personality and a team player
  • Well organized with attention to detail
  • Service orientated with strong communication skills
  • Ability to deal effectively with others in a diverse environment
  • Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and manage timelines effectively
  • Strong mechanical aptitude with effective interpersonal skills
  • Critical thinker
  • Experience working in a fleet shop
  • Fluent in English both written and spoken
  • Legally allowed to work in Canada
  • Gas, electrical welding, and fabrication skills an asset
  • Proficiency using diagnostic software, meters, gauges etc.
  • Experienced with Electrical, Hydraulic and Pneumatic system repairs and maintenance
  • Physically fit with the ability to work in conditions which may include varying weather and temperatures, heavy lifting (50 lbs / 23 kgs) and cramped quarters.
  • Ability to work through ambiguously worded driver repair requests by drilling down to the root cause and performing effective repairs
  • Willing to work overtime, weekends and after-hours emergency service call ins as required



Education and Experience:

  • (Red Seal) Journeyman Inter Provincial Truck and Transport Mechanic and/or Heavy Equipment Technician Certification. TQ's will also be considered.
  • High school graduation or BCAGD.
  • CVIP Inspectors licence an asset
  • BC Crane Safety Certificate min. level: Crane Mechanic Certification an asset
  • Forklift operators Certificate an asset
  • Class 3 license with air, a clean Drivers Abstract, Class 1 Driver's License will be considered an asset
  • Minimum 6 years shop and field experience
  • Experience repairing and servicing digger derrick trucks, aerial bucket trucks, small and medium sized construction equipment, back hoe's, dump trucks, utility vans, light duty trucks, various types of trailers and another equipment and vehicles that could be found working in a civil construction and overhead powerline company
  • Hydraulic, aerial manlift, digger derrick and crane service training courses or certifications considered an asset

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

  • Régime de retraite
  • Uniformes fournis
  • 2 semaines de vacance payées
  • Et beaucoup plus!

Responsabilités et obligations

  • Entretien préventif des moteurs diesels
  • Utiliser les divers logiciels de diagnostic
  • Diagnostiquer, identifier et solutionner les diverses réparations à effectuer
  • Entretenir et réparer les systèmes de démarrage, de refroidissement, de pneumatiques, hydrauliques, électriques, électroniques
  • Vérifier, diagnostiquer, réparer et ajuster les embrayages, les transmissions manuelles et automatiques, le système de freinage et les systèmes d’alimentation et d’injection
  • Effectuer divers travaux de soudure
  • Assurer la conformité des équipements
  • Suivre les formations hebdomadaires

Exigences

  • DEP en mécanique de véhicules lourds ou toute autre formation pertinente
  • Permis de conduire classe 5 (min). Classe 3 ou 1 constitue un atout
  • Posséder un coffre avec outils
  • Une bonne condition physique et mentale
  • Bonne éthique de travail et esprit d’équipe
  • Avoir initiative et autonomie et aptitude à bien communiquer
  • Sens de l’organisation et de la planification
  • Capacité à travailler dans des positions variées et à soulever des charges
  • Souci et respect des normes de sécurité
  • Facilité avec les technologies nouvelles

Ma route, mon succès!!

Enviro connexions est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi

Nous vous offrons la stabilité d’emploi, un environnement respectueux et sécuritaire. Enviro Connexions est le bon choix pour vous permettre de faire avancer votre carrière, de développer vos aptitudes tout en vous offrant le support requis à votre réussite. Voici une excellente opportunité pour un Mécanicien.']"

Description de l'entreprise

Accélérez votre carrière au sein d’un groupe d’ingénierie mondial à forte croissance. Chez SEGULA Technologies, vous travaillerez sur des projets passionnants et contribuerez à façonner l’avenir au sein d’une entreprise pour qui l’innovation est indissociable de l’ingénierie.

Impression 3D, réalité augmentée, véhicule autonome, usine du futur… rythment le quotidien de nos 10 000 ingénieux collaborateurs, pourquoi pas le vôtre ?

À côté de chez vous ou à l’autre bout de la planète, vous trouverez chez SEGULA Technologies l’opportunité qui donnera un sens nouveau à votre carrière !

Description du poste

Sous l’autorité du superviseur production, le mécanicien d'avion aura comme principales responsabilités :

95,B MECHANIC,Bowlero Corp,"KITCHENER, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/b-mechanic-kitchener-08--93209dd0-a318-4ac8-b9d0-3bc30f6b0b2d?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.67&_ga=2.153515199.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
Overview:

SUMMARY:     Repairs and maintains automatic Pinspotters / Pinsetters, lane and scoring equipment, building and all other bowling center equipment at the highest level of operating proficiency.   Assists in the repair and maintenance of the bowling facility.   Performs preventive maintenance, cleaning and /or minor repairs as directed by the center Facility Manager.

 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:  Primary duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following.

  • Maintains Pinspotters/Pinsetters and related bowling equipment to Bowlero Corporation specifications as directed.
  • Abides by and maintains safety procedures and operation procedures as required by Bowlero Corporation and OSHA.
  • Ensures that shop and machine area are clean and organized at all times.
  • Assists the center Facility Manager with the training of new mechanics.
  • Follows the preventive maintenance program for all center equipment (daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annually).
  • Monitors and maintains clean, consistent and scoreable lane conditions to USBC specifications were required.
  • Maintains lane conditioning equipment.
  • Monitors and performs daily center maintenance on HVAC, roofing, plumbing and electrical as instructed by Facility Manager/General Manager after proper training.
  • Quickly and safely corrects pin jams, ball return calls, and other malfunctions while bowling is in progress.
  • Assists in performing both general and emergency maintenance repairs as directed by the supervisor on duty.
  • Maintains and keeps up to date all necessary logs and frames per stop sheets.
  • Must complete the B- Mechanic training programs within specified time frame.
  • Ability to work varying shifts, weekends and holidays, as well as, extended workdays to support business needs.
  • Other duties may be assigned.

 

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:   n/a

 

QUALIFICATIONS: B-Mechanics must possess the ability to read, analyze, and interpret common technical manuals and schematics.   Responds to common inquiries or complaints from employees, customers and/or regulatory agencies.   Effectively communicates pertinent information to center management.   Applies principles of logical thinking to a wide range of practical problems.   Deals with nonverbal schematics (formulas, schematics, graphs, etc.) and a variety of abstract and concrete variables.

 

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE: High School Diploma or equivalent with algebra, geometry and/or applied mathematics and three to five years of related experience.   Relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and experience is also acceptable.

 

WORK ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Bowling center environment where you will walk, bend and stand for periods of time, and may be asked to lift up to 30lbs often, team lift up to 100lbs occasionally. The noise level is typical for bowling.

96,310S Mechanic,GoWrench,"ON, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/310s-mechanic--91102f58-b6b6-4143-9569-d1dd633ef428?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.68&_ga=2.153515199.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"



What is GoWrench Auto all about?

GoWrench Auto is an exciting mobile auto service company that performs automotive repairs and maintenance services for fleets and consumers at the customer's location. Home or work we are there.

Position:

GoWrench Auto is looking for an experienced and licensed technician with the right tools to join our exciting team!  Full time.

Responsibilities:

  • Do what you do best. Diagnose and repair approved services on customer vehicles.
  • Advise on all work performed after each service, vehicle conditions and recommendations
  • Always work in a clean and safe manner
  • Be friendly and personable and answer customer questions

Qualifications:

  • Must be a Licensed Automotive Service Technician 310S with 5+ years of experience
  • Must have their own tools
  • Ability to keep up to date with changing technology
  • Must be committed to providing an amazing customer experience


GoWrench Auto offers:

At GoWrench Auto, mechanics are a valued member of our team. Being part of our team will bring the following:

  • Highest wage in the Industry- between $40-70 per hour based on experience and applicant
  • Semi-flexible schedule - We operate 7 days per week.  Need a day off or want to make more? Pick up weekend days!
  • Guaranteed Hours
  • Industry-leading bonus program for superior performance.
  • The opportunity for growth into leadership positions

www.GoWrenchAuto.com

97,Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (CAT 01),Air Canada,"DORVAL, QC",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/aircraft-maintenance-engineer-cat-01-dorval-10--d0d8b18a-a607-4d48-bd95-6c5e790957c5?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.69&_ga=2.153515199.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.

Air Canada is presently looking for dynamic individuals to fill the permanent full-time positions of Aircraft Technicians or Aircraft Maintenance Engineers at our Montreal Maintenance Centre.

The position is located near the Montréal-Pierre Elliott Trudeau International Airport, Montreal. The current salary starts at %2431.50/hour, based on experience and according to the Collective Agreement.

Aircraft Technicians / Aircraft Maintenance Engineers are responsible for airframe maintenance and should have the following skill sets:

  • Ability to use the correct tools, methods, techniques and equipment required to perform aircraft maintenance.
  • Candidates should be able to read and understand various schematic diagrams for maintenance troubleshooting and be proficient with computers and diagnostic tools.
  • Individuals need to be ""team players"" with excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to maintain a customer focused attitude in a demanding, high stress environment.

Please take 2 minutes to watch the following video with more information about the Aircraft Technician/Aircraft Maintenance Engineer role:httpss://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cuwqi8PokME


  • Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Required
  • High School diploma.
  • You must have completed a recognized apprenticeship program, and/or have a least 4 years industry related experience.
  • Possession of a Transport Canada AME M2 or M1 license (Mandatory)
  • Possession of valid driver's license (Mandatory)
  • Able to successfully pass the pre-employment qualifying exam, physical and a security check.
  • Be available to work night, evenings and days including weekends and holidays.
  • Night shift is the permanent position for this posting. Possibility to change with seniority.
  • Be available to work night, evenings and days including weekends and holidays.
  • Eligible to work in Canada.
  • Ability to Pass and obtain an airside vehicle operator’s permit (Mandatory)
  • Possession of a restricted radio operators permit (aviation).
  • Ability to pass security clearance and obtain the Restricted area identity card (RAIC). Please refer to Transport Canada site for more details.
  • Employees in this role, conduct safety-critical work and as such, Air Canada medical standards must be met in order to qualify for the role. Candidates will be subject to a medical evaluation, including a drug and alcohol test and are expected to be free of any intoxicating substances.

Assets

  • Endorsements on Air Canada aircraft type.
  • Current security clearance.

Linguistic Requirements

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.

Diversity and Inclusion

Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest

column3: line-height:normal"">6 Full-Time
column4:
line-height:normal"">La Ronge, Prince Albert and Saskatoon SK

Rise Air is western Canada's largest full-service aviation operation. Based in La Ronge, Prince Albert, or Saskatoon, here is your opportunity to work in the fascinating aviation industry for a dynamic company that exceeds customers' expectations, strives for operational excellence, and has a strong employee culture.

Qualifications

Typically, the knowledge and skills required for this position include a high school diploma or equivalent, and a minimum three years' progressive AME experience for M1 License, or minimum three to five years' progressive experience for M2 License. Experience on Beechcraft King Air, 1900, ATR-42 and DHC-6 Twin Otter would be an asset.

Skills, knowledge, and abilities include:

  • Ability to hold and maintain a class 5 valid driver's license,
  • Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills.
  • Sound problem solving, decision-making, analytical thinking, planning, prioritization, and execution skills.
  • Ability to take initiative and ownership of projects and tasks and execute effectively and in a timely manner.
  • Strong leadership skills and a hands-on, self-motivated, and demonstrated positive, can-do attitude.
  • Excellent time management skills with the ability to organize, multi-task and prioritize.
  • Ability to support, strengthen and enhance safety initiatives.
column5: background:#ffffff"">Job Purpose
column6:
background:#ffffff"">Under the direction of the Base Engineer, this position is responsible for completing the day-to-day maintenance activities on our fleet of fixed-wing aircraft in accordance with Transport Canada approved standards

Primary Responsibilities

  • Report to the Crew Supervisor to receive all work assignments.
  • Work a variety of scheduled shifts as assigned to accommodate maintenance requirements.
  • Complete each task and associated maintenance documentation in an appropriate, safe, and timely manner.
  • Maintain close communication with senior maintenance personnel to ensure that mandated job processes and methodologies are understood and adhered to.
  • Perform daily inspections, pre-flight, post flight and quality control activities to ensure aircraft airworthiness and on-time departures.
  • Ensure that approved equipment and materials are utilized, and a high standard or workmanship is maintained.
  • Ensure that all components installed on aircrafts are pre-approved and properly certified.
  • Assist in keeping the maintenance office, hangar, and shop areas clean and ensure equipment is appropriately stored/returned after tasks are completed.
  • Attend training courses as approved.
  • Always adhere to the Safety Management System (SMS) policy and ensure a safe workplace.

General Responsibilities
column7: vertical-align:baseline"">Develop and maintain knowledge of the company's mission, vision and values.
column8: vertical-align:baseline"">Foster a team-based environment through collaborative working relationships.
column9: vertical-align:baseline"">Ensure optimal communication with all employees and internal partners.
column10: vertical-align:baseline"">Maintain current knowledge of all Transport Canada rules, regulations and policies.
column11:
vertical-align:baseline"">Participate in special projects as required.

Typical Physical and Cognitive Demands

  • Work a variety of scheduled shifts as assigned to accommodate maintenance requirements.
  • Majority of the work is completed in an indoor or outdoor hangar environment.
  • Ability to work on elevated workstations.
  • Ability to work long, sometimes irregular hours.
  • Able to prioritize and organize objectives and meet deadlines in a fast-paced office environment.
  • Must quickly adapt to changing assignments.
  • Required to act professionally and use mature judgment.
  • Ground and/or air travel required.

As this is a Safety Sensitive Position, selected candidate(s) must test negative for impairing substances and alcohol prior to employment.

99,Mechanic - 310S/310T,Voyago,"Stouffville, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/mechanic-310s-310t-stouffville-08--792fee6f-e6e2-4646-9b67-b5d729c97000?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.71&_ga=2.153515199.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

We Are The Employer Brand of Choice. It is our mission to be your best choice when seeking a career in Transportation. We believe in creating lasting relationships with our employees, one built on Trust and Respect.

And our employees would agree, having selected us as a Great Place To Work through the annual survey measuring Employee attitudes at Voyago.

Here’s a look at what makes us A Great Place To Work:

84% Agreed “Voyago is a physically safe place to work…”

80% Agreed “I can be myself at Voyago…”

81% Agreed “Management has kept me well-informed…”

A Great Place To Work Certification means that we take your happiness seriously, and we work hard to ensure you are highly engaged and informed on important topics that keep Voyago on the move.

Help shape the future of mobility. Voyago is currently recruiting for a 310S/310T Mechanic in York - Gormley, Ontario.

Voyago is Ontario’s Leading Mobility company, a subsidiary of Transdev. We’re hiring dynamic, high achievers looking to be Difference Makers within the industry. Voyago continues to advance across Ontario with our multi-model platform covering a variety of segments including Medical Transportation, Student Transportation, and the Public sector with Medium/Micro Rural and Urban Transit, Accessible Needs Para-Transit, and On Demand Mobility.

Our employee success is built on our commitment and emphasis on training and orientation process. Voyago prides itself on the growth of our employees by supporting and encouraging them to develop skills that lead to successful careers.

Voyago believes in the strength of our people and remains committed to our Golden Values statement reflecting our promise of performance to our employees, customers, and communities in which we operate.

Our teams are continuously recognized as top performers in Safety and Client Satisfaction awards. Voyago is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Safest Employers and a recipient of the Excellence Award for several years.

We are People and Safety First. So come join us and help shape the future of mobility at a Great Place To Work company.

Position Overview

Reporting directly to the Fleet Manager and Shop Supervisor, the Service Technician is responsible for evaluating and ensuring vehicle safety through preventative maintenance as required and all in compliance with all Ministry of Transportation (MTO) and Voyago's guidelines. Utilize parts from inventory or order parts necessary through the Fleet Management software to make repairs. Complete repairs in a timely manner. Service vehicles in accordance with corporate policies and procedures. Keep work environment clean and tidy. Complete required reports as directed (i.e. sign-off on driver initiated repair logs and log books, and PM service logs by division).

The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications that include, but are not limited to, the following:


  • Possess a minimum 310S/ 310T
  • ODP certification with A/C experience.
  • Have experience and working knowledge of light duty diesel repair, as well as gasoline.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills and sound organizational competencies.
  • Demonstrated leadership, problem-solving, and team-building skills.
  • Excellent proven customer service experience.
  • Valid G class driving license.
  • Possess clean driving record and provide a copy for personal file.


  • $ 500.00 Annual tool allowance
  • $100.00 boot allowance
  • Uniforms and Winter Jackets provided and laundered on site
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
  • Employee Referral Bonus
  • Life Insurance, Disability, Health Savings Account
  • Exciting employee perks and discounts with partnering companies and agencies
  • Paid by the hour – for your entire shift
  • Employee Certified “Great Place to Work”
  • Current work week Monday to Friday, with weekends off
  • Rewarding career with a growing company
  • Great company culture
  • Focus on Innovation and Sustainable Environmental Initiatives
  • Subsidiary of Global Transportation Provider (Transdev)


Sounds Interesting? Apply today to our Recruitment Specialist, Narinder Gill via email at narinder.gill@voyago.ca

Voyago is committed to provide accommodation for individuals with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. Accommodations are available upon request of the internal or external applicant. If you require an accommodation due to a disability for an interview, please notify Human Resources directly to make appropriate arrangements when contacted for an interview.

We thank all applicants however only those under consideration will be contacted.

Great company. Great people. Great opportunities.

As a Service Tech IV at United Rentals, you’ll use your skills to perform maintenance and repairs of complex equipment with limited or no supervision in a highly skilled, safe, and professional manner. Every day, you can improve and challenge yourself, and if you have the desire and ambition, you’ll have the potential to work towards leadership roles in our Service Department. Like every member of our team, we will rely on you to provide exceptional customer service to our customers.

If you would enjoy the chance to make your mark with the world’s largest equipment rental provider, consider a future with United Rentals. You will be supported by a strong management team that will help you achieve your goals. Plus, you will have the opportunity to relocate to one of our 1,000+ locations.

Additional duties include the following:

  • Maintenance and repair of complex mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and diesel systems on a variety of rental and customer equipment and tools while using a high degree of independent judgment

  • When required, travel to customer job sites for repair/maintenance of rental or customer owned equipment
column2:
must maintain service vehicle in a clean and professional manner

  • Assist in the training of lower level technicians as needed

  • Maintain paperwork/electronic documentation of work performed (work orders) in a complete and timely manner on a daily basis

  • Assist with pick-up and delivery of equipment &
column3:
parts

  • Other duties assigned as needed

    • Job Requirements:

    • High School diploma or equivalent

    • Valid driver's license with acceptable driving record

    • 5+ years of experience repairing/maintaining equipment and tools

    • Advanced mechanical aptitude and working knowledge of tools

    • Extensive knowledge of construction equipment with an advanced understanding of schematics and diagrams

    • Must own tools applicable to position

    • Superior customer service, teamwork and verbal/written communication skills

    • Ability to frequently lift items up to 45 lbs.

    At United Rentals, the largest equipment rental company, we believe that it takes great employees to build a great organization – and we’re passionate about helping our people grow professionally and embrace teamwork in everything they do. Our culture is based on our corporate values and centers on mutual respect, job satisfaction, diversity and a shared responsibility to build a better future.

    What's in it for you?

column1: 101,Mécanicien (Réparateur de wagons),Canadian National Railway Company,"Senneterre, QC",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/m%C3%A9canicien-r%C3%A9parateur-de-wagons-senneterre-10--7ddfbb84-40dd-4131-93cc-76b3b6af68a2?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.73&_ga=2.153515199.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
column3: font-size:15px"">Le CN offre de nombreuses possibilités pour les travailleurs de métiers spécialisés qui aiment apprendre constamment et souhaitent faire carrière dans une équipe axée sur la sécurité. Vous travaillerez sur équipements à la fine pointe de la technologie et des wagons de train qui transportent des marchandises du Pacifique à l’Atlantique et jusqu’au golfe du Mexique. Vous serez fiers de votre travail, car vous saurez que vous contribuez à la santé de l’économie. Vous pourrez également améliorer vos compétences grâce à la formation rémunérée. Nous offrons des carrières valorisantes car notre travail fait une différence. Embarquez avec nous!
column4: margin-left:0in
column5: font-size:24px"">Résumé des fonctions
column6: margin-left:0in
column7: font-size:15px"">Le mécanicien ou la mécanicienne Matériel remorque inspecte, entretient, construit et répare des wagons et du matériel ferroviaire conformément à la réglementation fédérale et aux règles du CN. La personne titulaire du poste est considérée comme étant un apprenti mécanicien ou une apprentie mécanicienne jusqu’à ce que cette personne obtienne le titre de compagnon mécanicien ou de compagne mécanicienne Matériel remorque (consulter la description de la formation ci-dessous).
column8: margin-left:0in
column9: font-size:24px"">Principales responsabilités
column10:
margin-left:20px"">
  • Inspecter les wagons et leurs composants conformément aux règles des associations ferroviaires et de la Federal Railway Administration ainsi qu’aux normes d’exploitation de la Compagnie
  • Effectuer toutes les interventions d’entretien programmées, ponctuelles et préventives et les réparations sur les wagons, le châssis, la charpente, les dispositifs de sécurité, l’appareil de choc et de traction, y compris les essais connexes
  • Réparer et installer des pièces de wagon comme des compresseurs, des valves pneumatiques, des paliers et roulements, des attelages ainsi que des cylindres pneumatiques et des conduits
  • Utiliser des outils à main, des outils à moteur, du matériel de soudage, des chalumeaux oxyacétyléniques et des instruments de mesure
  • Conduire des véhicules de transport, y compris des grues, des camions, des locotracteurs et autre matériel d’atelier.
  • Rédiger des rapports d’inspection, d’entretien et de travaux, et consigner les détails sur les imprimés prévus, conformément aux directives en vigueur
column11: margin-left:0in
column12: font-size:24px"">Conditions de travail
column13:
margin-left:20px"">
  • Travail par quarts, les fins de semaine et les jours fériés, et heures supplémentaires occasionnelles au besoin
  • Travail effectué en partie à l’extérieur dans diverses conditions météorologiques et environnementales
  • Tâches exigeant souvent de se pencher, de se plier, de s’accroupir, de s’agenouiller et de travailler au-dessus de sa tête
column14:
de soulever et de transporter une charge pesant jusqu’à 22 kg (50 livres), et parfois même jusqu’à 39 kg (85 livres)
  • Capacité à monter dans des échelles ou à se tenir en équilibre, ainsi que de tenir des objets
column15:
bonne coordination œil-main
  • Possibilité de devoir travailler loin de son terminal désigné
column18:
margin-left:20px"">
  • Expérience acquise en soudage dans le cadre d’une formation officielle ou d’un travail
  • Diplôme d’études secondaires ou l’équivalent
  • Avoir au moins 18 ans
  • Obligation de répondre à toutes les exigences d’évaluation de l’aptitude au travail pour le poste ainsi qu’à toutes les exigences en matière de sécurité
  • Permis de conduire en règle
  • Capacité à travailler de façon autonome, à s’adapter à des conditions changeantes et à bien gérer le stress
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe et à entretenir des relations positives avec les autres
  • Bonne compréhension orale et écrite et bonnes aptitudes en rédaction
  • Empressement à bien faire son travail tout en respectant les normes de qualité et de sécurité et en assurant la satisfaction du client
  • Connaissance des outils et des instruments électriques et électroniques
  • Capacité à déterminer l’état des objets ou des pièces en ce qui a trait à l’usure ou aux avaries
  • Formation professionnelle ou technique et connaissance des règles d’exploitation ferroviaire
  • Connaissance de base des outils informatiques
column22: font-size:15px"">La personne titulaire du poste reçoit une formation pratique comportant des cours tant théoriques que pratiques, sur une période de 3 semaines à raison de 40 heures par semaine. Selon son degré d’expérience, la personne qui occupe ce poste peut être tenue de suivre un programme d’apprentissage de 4 années de pratique spécifique par CN et de participer à une série de cours à son lieu de travail au Canada. La formation comprend les éléments constitutifs du matériel roulant, l’inspection des wagons, les essais de frein sur véhicule individuel, les marchandises spéciales de niveau 2, la réparation de wagons marchandises, les méthodes de levage des wagons, le soudage en milieu ferroviaire, les nacelles élévatrices, les règles d’exploitation en triage et d’autres éléments pertinents pour le poste. La réussite de cette formation est essentielle à l’exécution des futures tâches.
column24: font-size:15px"">*Ce poste est syndiqué. Par conséquent, le salaire et les avantages sociaux sont régis par la convention collective en vigueur.
column28:
font-size:15px"">En tant que chef de file dans les domaines du transport et de la logistique en Amérique du Nord, nous sommes un véritable pilier de l’économie. Forts d’une équipe d’environ 25 000 cheminots, nous avons pour priorité de faire progresser notre entreprise et l’économie. Nous transportons annuellement des marchandises d’une valeur de 200 G$ US pour un large éventail de secteurs, tels les ressources naturelles, les produits manufacturés et les biens de consommation, sur un réseau de 20 000 milles qui couvre le Canada et le centre des États-Unis. Le CN est la seule entreprise canadienne à figurer dans la catégorie du secteur du transport et de l’infrastructure du transport du Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) World. Créé en 1999, l’indice DJSI World est l’indice de référence en ce qui a trait au développement durable. Au CN, nous travaillons comme UNE ÉQUIPE axée sur la sécurité et nos clients, offrant l’excellence sur le plan de l’exploitation et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement pour produire des résultats.  

Le CN exige que tous lesmembres de son personnel soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 etqu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat devaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales enpropriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents etfournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN auCanada.

La forme grammaticale utilisée dans ce document vaut tant pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Le CN souscrit au principe de l’équité en emploi et invite toutes les personnes qualifiées à présenter leur candidature. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt
column29:
cependant, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue. Veuillez consulter régulièrement vos courriels, car les communications sont surtout envoyées par courrier électronique.

102,Mechanic,Forbes Bros Ltd.,"Prince Albert, SK",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/mechanic-prince-albert-11--39a66966-e7bc-404c-bd0f-f5329b3e6afc?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.74&_ga=2.153515199.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

To support operational growth, Forbes Bros is looking for a Commercial Transport or Heavy Equipment Mechanic to join our team. Reporting to the Fleet Maintenance Lead, the Mechanic maintains, repairs and overhauls heavy vehicles and industrial equipment at our Prince Albert, Saskatchewan location.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform preventative and corrective maintenance of all systems associated with work equipment (mechanical, electrical, pneumatic, and hydraulic)
  • When required performs field service calls
  • Evaluate parts for reuse, repair, or replacement
  • Confer on a regular basis with Manager on any operational deficiencies
  • Use various hand and power hand tools. Candidate must supply metric and std hand tools up to 1 1/2"" (38mm) socket and wrench size and chest that is suitably equipped for general mechanical work in a heavy fleet shop.
  • Operates equipment such as overhead or mobile cranes and forklifts to assist in assignments
  • Diagnose equipment problems and take corrective action to minimize the impact on crew production
  • Adapts to new methods, processes, material, and equipment
  • Prepare and submit equipment maintenance records, time sheets, etc.
  • Follows prescribed safety procedures including the use of safety clothing and equipment
  • Ensures cleanliness and organization of shop, maintenance of shop tools and equipment, loading/unloading and storage of equipment, including service trucks
  • Working on heavy duty and on road equipment such as excavators, wheel Loaders, backhoes, digger derrick trucks, aerial bucket trucks, trailers, and dump trucks
  • Assists other Technicians as needed

Requirements:

  • Self-directed, outgoing personality and a team player
  • Well organized with attention to detail
  • Service orientated with strong communication skills
  • Ability to deal effectively with others in a diverse environment
  • Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and manage timelines effectively
  • Strong mechanical aptitude with effective interpersonal skills
  • Critical thinker
  • Experience working in a fleet shop
  • Fluent in English both written and spoken
  • Legally allowed to work in Canada
  • Gas, electrical welding, and fabrication skills an asset
  • Proficiency using diagnostic software, meters, gauges etc.
  • Experienced with Electrical, Hydraulic and Pneumatic system repairs and maintenance
  • Physically fit with the ability to work in conditions which may include varying weather and temperatures, heavy lifting (50 lbs / 23 kgs) and cramped quarters.
  • Ability to work through ambiguously worded driver repair requests by drilling down to the root cause and performing effective repairs
  • Willing to work overtime, weekends and after-hours emergency service call ins as required



Education and Experience:

  • (Red Seal) Journeyman Inter Provincial Truck and Transport Mechanic and/or Heavy Equipment Technician Certification. TQ's will also be considered.
  • High school graduation or BCAGD.
  • CVIP Inspectors licence an asset
  • BC Crane Safety Certificate min. level: Crane Mechanic Certification an asset
  • Forklift operators Certificate an asset
  • Class 3 license with air, a clean Drivers Abstract, Class 1 Driver's License will be considered an asset
  • Minimum 6 years shop and field experience
  • Experience repairing and servicing digger derrick trucks, aerial bucket trucks, small and medium sized construction equipment, back hoe's, dump trucks, utility vans, light duty trucks, various types of trailers and another equipment and vehicles that could be found working in a civil construction and overhead powerline company
  • Hydraulic, aerial manlift, digger derrick and crane service training courses or certifications considered an asset

What We Offer:

Forbes Bros offers an attractive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, comprehensive benefit plan and a rewarding pension program. Forbes Bros has an open and team oriented culture that focuses on communication, innovation and respect in the workplace!

Forbes Bros Ltd. (FBL) is an equal opportunity employer committed to best practice recruiting and hiring, to promote gender equity and workplace diversity. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements noted and who earn an invitation to interview will be contacted.

Waste Management (WM), a Fortune 250 company, is the leading provider of comprehensive waste and environmental services in North America. We are strongly committed to a foundation of operating excellence, professionalism and financial strength. WM serves nearly 25 million customers in residential, commercial, industrial and municipal markets throughout North America through a network of collection operations, transfer stations, landfills, recycling facilities and waste-based energy production projects.

Join our Waste Management team, the industry leader since 1971. With over 41,000 proud employees, Waste Management has the largest trucking fleet in the waste industry - over 18,000 trucks, and leads in CNG advancement with the largest fleet of class 8 Natural Gas Vehicles in North America. We offer opportunities in 48 states, the District of Columbia, and Canada.

column3: text-align:justify"">If you are a mechanic who likes working in the field where the action begins, ensuring that equipment and machinery operate at their optimal level… then keep reading, this role may be for you!
column4: margin-right:0cm
column5: text-align:justify"">We seek a mechanic for our plant and two bog operations in the Carrot River, Saskatchewan region. Our industry is horticulture and agriculture, but you may better know us by some of our brands such as: Pro-Mix, C-I-L, Wilson and Alaskan.
column6: margin-right:0cm
column7: text-align:justify"">We are searching for that talented individual who will be based out of our Plant in Carrot River but will also support our surrounding bogs with mechanical needs as required. This is a key role as our bog operations are the first step in the peat production process which allows our products to reach clients throughout North America. As these sites in Carrot River are some of our newest ones, soon shops will be built to support these operations.
column8: margin-right:0cm
column9: text-align:justify"">Are you ready to take on this challenge?
column10: margin-right:0cm
column11:
text-align:justify"">Working as a mechanic with Premier Tech means…

  • coordinating and undertaking the repair and preventative maintenance program for the harvest and mobile equipment.
  • troubleshooting and maintaining power transmissions, vacuum, hydraulic, and pneumatic systems with the added talents of fabrication and welding.
  • providing important feedback while assessing and diagnosing issues.
  • making recommendations and completing the approved work orders within the established timelines.
  • moving or operating harvest equipment, as required.
  • working safely every day, while keeping the safety of yourself and others at the forefront.
column12: margin-right:0cm
column13:
text-align:justify"">Is this role for YOU?

  • You are a team player who places a high value on safety.
  • You have earned your heavy equipment technician ticket or are a 3rd or 4th year apprentice working towards obtaining the journeyman ticket. A combination of experience and a journeyman ticket in a similar trade may be considered. 
  • You are resourceful with a strong mechanical aptitude are some of your traits.
  • You have experience with heavy equipment and can adapt to working in various weather conditions.
  • You are driven by the concept of having the equipment ready to maximize efficiency and production.
  • You have the capacity to work independently and can multitask within a fast-paced environment.
  • You are available for overtime shifts, as required.
column15: text-align:justify"">Working for Premier Tech’s Growers and Consumers business group means being a major player in the production of growing media adapted to our clients’ needs, to the public and professional markets. It means increasing crop yields, creating beautiful living environments and protecting people, homes and gardens.

106,Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (CAT 01),Air Canada,"DORVAL, QC",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/aircraft-maintenance-engineer-cat-01-dorval-10--bf16968f-fff9-4cd5-8171-834fac280fc4?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.78&_ga=2.157266108.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"

Description

Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.

Air Canada is presently looking for dynamic individuals to fill the permanent full-time positions of Aircraft Technicians or Aircraft Maintenance Engineers at our Montreal Maintenance Centre.

The position is located near the Montréal-Pierre Elliott Trudeau International Airport, Montreal. The current salary starts at $31.50/hour, based on experience and according to the Collective Agreement.

Aircraft Technicians / Aircraft Maintenance Engineers are responsible for airframe maintenance and should have the following skill sets:

  • Ability to use the correct tools, methods, techniques and equipment required to perform aircraft maintenance.
  • Candidates should be able to read and understand various schematic diagrams for maintenance troubleshooting and be proficient with computers and diagnostic tools.
  • Individuals need to be ""team players"" with excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to maintain a customer focused attitude in a demanding, high stress environment.

Please take 2 minutes to watch the following video with more information about the Aircraft Technician/Aircraft Maintenance Engineer role: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cuwqi8PokME

Qualifications

  • Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Required
  • High School diploma.
  • You must have completed a recognized apprenticeship program, and/or have a least 4 years industry related experience.
  • Possession of a Transport Canada AME M2 or M1 license (Mandatory)
  • Possession of valid driver's license (Mandatory)
  • Able to successfully pass the pre-employment qualifying exam, physical and a security check.
  • Be available to work night, evenings and days including weekends and holidays.
  • Night shift is the permanent position for this posting. Possibility to change with seniority.
  • Be available to work night, evenings and days including weekends and holidays.
  • Eligible to work in Canada.
  • Ability to Pass and obtain an airside vehicle operator’s permit (Mandatory)
  • Possession of a restricted radio operators permit (aviation).
  • Ability to pass security clearance and obtain the Restricted area identity card (RAIC). Please refer to Transport Canada site for more details.
  • Employees in this role, conduct safety-critical work and as such, Air Canada medical standards must be met in order to qualify for the role. Candidates will be subject to a medical evaluation, including a drug and alcohol test and are expected to be free of any intoxicating substances.

Assets

  • Endorsements on Air Canada aircraft type.
  • Current security clearance.

Linguistic Requirements

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.

Diversity and Inclusion

Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest

We Are The Employer Brand of Choice. It is our mission to be your best choice when seeking a career in Transportation. We believe in creating lasting relationships with our employees, one built on Trust and Respect.

And our employees would agree, having selected us as a Great Place To Work through the annual survey measuring Employee attitudes at Voyago.

Here’s a look at what makes us A Great Place To Work:

84% Agreed “Voyago is a physically safe place to work…”

80% Agreed “I can be myself at Voyago…”

81% Agreed “Management has kept me well-informed…”

A Great Place To Work Certification means that we take your happiness seriously, and we work hard to ensure you are highly engaged and informed on important topics that keep Voyago on the move.

Help shape the future of mobility. Voyago is currently recruiting for a 310S/310T Mechanic in Gormley - York, Ontario.

Voyago is Ontario’s Leading Mobility company, a subsidiary of Transdev. We’re hiring dynamic, high achievers looking to be Difference Makers within the industry. Voyago continues to advance across Ontario with our multi-model platform covering a variety of segments including Medical Transportation, Student Transportation, and the Public sector with Medium/Micro Rural and Urban Transit, Accessible Needs Para-Transit, and On Demand Mobility.

Our employee success is built on our commitment and emphasis on training and orientation process. Voyago prides itself on the growth of our employees by supporting and encouraging them to develop skills that lead to successful careers.

Voyago believes in the strength of our people and remains committed to our Golden Values statement reflecting our promise of performance to our employees, customers, and communities in which we operate.

Our teams are continuously recognized as top performers in Safety and Client Satisfaction awards. Voyago is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Safest Employers and a recipient of the Excellence Award for several years.

We are People and Safety First. So come join us and help shape the future of mobility at a Great Place To Work company.

Position Overview

Reporting directly to the Fleet Manager and Shop Supervisor, the Service Technician is responsible for evaluating and ensuring vehicle safety through preventative maintenance as required and all in compliance with all Ministry of Transportation (MTO) and Voyago's guidelines. Utilize parts from inventory or order parts necessary through the Fleet Management software to make repairs. Complete repairs in a timely manner. Service vehicles in accordance with corporate policies and procedures. Keep work environment clean and tidy. Complete required reports as directed (i.e. sign-off on driver initiated repair logs and log books, and PM service logs by division).

The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications that include, but are not limited to, the following:


  • Possess a minimum 310S/ 310T
  • ODP certification with A/C experience.
  • Have experience and working knowledge of light duty diesel repair, as well as gasoline.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills and sound organizational competencies.
  • Demonstrated leadership, problem-solving, and team-building skills.
  • Excellent proven customer service experience.
  • Valid G class driving license.
  • Possess clean driving record and provide a copy for personal file.


  • $ 500.00 Annual tool allowance
  • $100.00 boot allowance
  • Uniforms and Winter Jackets provided and laundered on site
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
  • Employee Referral Bonus
  • Life Insurance, Disability, Health Savings Account
  • Exciting employee perks and discounts with partnering companies and agencies
  • Paid by the hour – for your entire shift
  • Employee Certified “Great Place to Work”
  • Current work week Monday to Friday, with weekends off
  • Rewarding career with a growing company
  • Great company culture
  • Focus on Innovation and Sustainable Environmental Initiatives
  • Subsidiary of Global Transportation Provider (Transdev)


Sounds Interesting? Apply today to our Recruitment Specialist, Narinder Gill via email at narinder.gill@voyago.ca

Voyago is committed to provide accommodation for individuals with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. Accommodations are available upon request of the internal or external applicant. If you require an accommodation due to a disability for an interview, please notify Human Resources directly to make appropriate arrangements when contacted for an interview.

We thank all applicants however only those under consideration will be contacted.

112,Mechanic,Waste Management,"Petrolia, ON",https://www.monster.ca/job-openings/mechanic-petrolia-08--4d1ab8ef-0024-4bc8-9fb4-596fb6c31022?sid=ba9950ab-1d06-42f1-8b40-78ccfc2c9440&jvo=m.go.sc.84&_ga=2.157266108.607802500.1651867673-2065617596.1651867673&hidesmr=1,"
Mechanic - ( 22007676 )

Primary Location : Canada-Ontario-Petrolia

Shift : Day

:

Job : Technician/Mechanic

Equal Opportunity Employer

$5,000 Sign On Bonus

What is the value of a WM job?

The value of a WM job is more than a paycheck. It’s one way to create opportunities for you and your family.

We Are People First: We foster an environment where all teammates feel welcomed, valued and seen

We Are Committed to Growth: Training and progressive opportunities for professional development

We Are Stable: Our employees are at home every day and doing essential and meaningful work

We Are Investing in You: Competitive compensation, significant benefits, people first and much more!

Who are we? #WeAreWM

Waste Management (WM), a Fortune 250 company, is the leading provider of comprehensive waste and environmental services in North America. We are strongly committed to a foundation of operating excellence, professionalism and financial strength. WM serves nearly 25 million customers in residential, commercial, industrial and municipal markets throughout North America through a network of collection operations, transfer stations, landfills, recycling facilities and waste-based energy production projects.

Join our Waste Management team, the industry leader since 1971. With over 41,000 proud employees, Waste Management has the largest trucking fleet in the waste industry - over 18,000 trucks, and leads in CNG advancement with the largest fleet of class 8 Natural Gas Vehicles in North America. We offer opportunities in 48 states, the District of Columbia, and Canada.

Tired of just doing preventative maintenance or working only on engines? Are you ready to take the next step and work on equipment that requires a high level of skill - hydraulics, electrical, diagnostics - using modern maintenance practices and technologies? Are you looking for that right opportunity which will allow you to use and be rewarded for your skills and ability, and provide opportunity for growth? Our technicians are trained to provide superior maintenance on both diesel equipment and, at some locations, on our growing fleet of CNG trucks. We care about our technician’s safety and show it by demanding solid safety practices of all our technicians and managers. Pride, safety, training, growth, opportunity, great benefits, rewards – check us out, we may be the company for you.

I. Job Summary

Under general supervision, performs preventive maintenance services and inspects, diagnoses and repairs vehicles and equipment.

II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the essential duties satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned and may vary by location.

+ Works under limited supervision and selects from written instructions and established procedures to accomplish assigned tasks.

+ Performs repairs and assigned preventive maintenance services.

+ Performs inspection, diagnosis and repair of electrical, hydraulic, suspension, brake and air systems on vehicles and equipment.

+ Utilizes vehicle computer electronics systems to interpret failure modes to initiate or assign repairs.

+ Estimates time and material costs on vehicle repairs and requisitions new parts.

+ Performs all work within Standard Repair Times (SRTs).

+ Performs service calls for emergency breakdowns.

+ Conducts safety checks on vehicles.

+ Completes required paperwork utilizing fleet maintenance software program associated with repairing vehicles, documenting parts usage, and accounting for repair times.

+ Reviews, completes or assigns repairs identified on Driver Vehicle Inspection Reports.

+ Maintains a clean, safe work area in compliance with Corporate / OHS Standards, and performs all work in accordance with established safety procedures.

+ Completes all assigned mandatory online and in class training modules.

+ Must have all required tools to fulfill the responsibilities and requirements of the job.

III. Supervisory Responsibilities

This job has no supervisory duties.

IV. Qualifications

The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.

A. Education and Experience

+ Education: None required.

+ Experience: Three (3) years of relative work experience or more (in addition to education requirement).

B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements

+ Valid driver’s license and must have acceptable driving record.

+ Valid Journeyman certificate in one of the following trades
column2:
+ Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic (BC, NU, SK),

+ Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic (Construction) (QC),

+ Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic (Non-Construction) (QC),

+ Heavy Equipment Service Technician (NB),

+ Heavy Equipment Technician (NT),

+ Heavy Equipment Technician - Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic (Off Road) (AB),

+ Heavy Equipment Technician (AB),

+ Heavy Equipment Technician - Truck and Transport Mechanic (AB),

+ Truck and Transport Mechanic (SK, MB),

+ Commercial Transport Vehicle Mechanic (BC),

+ Heavy Equipment Technician - Truck and Transport Mechanic (NT),

+ Truck and Coach Technician (ON),

+ Truck and Transport Service Technician (NB),

+ Truck and Transport Technician (YT)

C. Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required

+ None required.

V. Work Environment

Listed below are key points regarding environmental demands and work environment of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

+ Required to use motor coordination with finger dexterity (such as keyboarding, machine operation, etc.) most of the work day
column3: + Required to exert physical effort in handling objects less than _ pounds most of the work day
column4: + Required to be exposed to physical occupational risks (such as cuts, burns, exposure to toxic chemicals, etc.) often
column5: + Required to be exposed to physical environment which involves dirt, odors, noise, weather extremes or similar elements often
column6:
+ Normal setting for this job is: repair/maintenance shop.

Benefits

At Waste Management, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. As well as a Stock Purchase Plan, Company Pension, and more! Our employees also receive Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days. Please note that benefits may vary by site.

If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been looking for, please click ""Apply.”

Great company. Great people. Great opportunities.

As a Service Tech II at United Rentals, you’ll use your skills to perform maintenance, preventive maintenance and minor repairs of equipment in a safe and professional manner. Every day, you can improve and challenge yourself, and if you have the desire and ambition, you’ll have the potential to work towards higher level Tech roles in our Service Department. Like every member of our team, we will rely on you to provide exceptional customer service to our customers.

If you would enjoy the chance to make your mark with the world’s largest equipment rental provider, consider a future with United Rentals. You will be supported by a strong management team that will help you achieve your goals. Plus, you will have the opportunity to relocate to one of our 1,000+ locations.

Additional duties include the following:

  • Perform maintenance, preventive maintenance and repair of rental equipment and tools involving mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and diesel systems

Primary Location : Canada-Ontario-Kingston

Shift : Day

:

Job : Technician/Mechanic

Equal Opportunity Employer

$5,000 Sign On Bonus

What is the value of a WM job?

The value of a WM job is more than a paycheck. It’s one way to create opportunities for you and your family.

We Are People First: We foster an environment where all teammates feel welcomed, valued and seen

We Are Committed to Growth: Training and progressive opportunities for professional development

We Are Stable: Our employees are at home every day and doing essential and meaningful work

We Are Investing in You: Competitive compensation, significant benefits, people first and much more!

Who are we? #WeAreWM

Waste Management (WM), a Fortune 250 company, is the leading provider of comprehensive waste and environmental services in North America. We are strongly committed to a foundation of operating excellence, professionalism and financial strength. WM serves nearly 25 million customers in residential, commercial, industrial and municipal markets throughout North America through a network of collection operations, transfer stations, landfills, recycling facilities and waste-based energy production projects.

Join our Waste Management team, the industry leader since 1971. With over 41,000 proud employees, Waste Management has the largest trucking fleet in the waste industry - over 18,000 trucks, and leads in CNG advancement with the largest fleet of class 8 Natural Gas Vehicles in North America. We offer opportunities in 48 states, the District of Columbia, and Canada.

Tired of just doing preventative maintenance or working only on engines? Are you ready to take the next step and work on equipment that requires a high level of skill - hydraulics, electrical, diagnostics - using modern maintenance practices and technologies? Are you looking for that right opportunity which will allow you to use and be rewarded for your skills and ability, and provide opportunity for growth? Our technicians are trained to provide superior maintenance on both diesel equipment and, at some locations, on our growing fleet of CNG trucks. We care about our technician’s safety and show it by demanding solid safety practices of all our technicians and managers. Pride, safety, training, growth, opportunity, great benefits, rewards – check us out, we may be the company for you.

I. Job Summary

Under general supervision, performs preventive maintenance services and inspects, diagnoses and repairs vehicles and equipment.

II. Essential Duties and Responsibilities

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the essential duties satisfactorily. Other minor duties may be assigned and may vary by location.

+ Works under limited supervision and selects from written instructions and established procedures to accomplish assigned tasks.

+ Performs repairs and assigned preventive maintenance services.

+ Performs inspection, diagnosis and repair of electrical, hydraulic, suspension, brake and air systems on vehicles and equipment.

+ Utilizes vehicle computer electronics systems to interpret failure modes to initiate or assign repairs.

+ Estimates time and material costs on vehicle repairs and requisitions new parts.

+ Performs all work within Standard Repair Times (SRTs).

+ Performs service calls for emergency breakdowns.

+ Conducts safety checks on vehicles.

+ Completes required paperwork utilizing fleet maintenance software program associated with repairing vehicles, documenting parts usage, and accounting for repair times.

+ Reviews, completes or assigns repairs identified on Driver Vehicle Inspection Reports.

+ Maintains a clean, safe work area in compliance with Corporate / OHS Standards, and performs all work in accordance with established safety procedures.

+ Completes all assigned mandatory online and in class training modules.

+ Must have all required tools to fulfill the responsibilities and requirements of the job.

III. Supervisory Responsibilities

This job has no supervisory duties.

IV. Qualifications

The requirements listed below are representative of the qualifications necessary to perform the job.

A. Education and Experience

+ Education: None required.

+ Experience: Three (3) years of relative work experience or more (in addition to education requirement).

B. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations or Other Requirements

+ Valid driver’s license and must have acceptable driving record.

+ Valid Journeyman certificate in one of the following trades
column2:
+ Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic (BC, NU, SK),

+ Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic (Construction) (QC),

+ Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic (Non-Construction) (QC),

+ Heavy Equipment Service Technician (NB),

+ Heavy Equipment Technician (NT),

+ Heavy Equipment Technician - Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic (Off Road) (AB),

+ Heavy Equipment Technician (AB),

+ Heavy Equipment Technician - Truck and Transport Mechanic (AB),

+ Truck and Transport Mechanic (SK, MB),

+ Commercial Transport Vehicle Mechanic (BC),

+ Heavy Equipment Technician - Truck and Transport Mechanic (NT),

+ Truck and Coach Technician (ON),

+ Truck and Transport Service Technician (NB),

+ Truck and Transport Technician (YT)

C. Other Knowledge, Skills or Abilities Required

+ None required.

V. Work Environment

Listed below are key points regarding environmental demands and work environment of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

+ Required to use motor coordination with finger dexterity (such as keyboarding, machine operation, etc.) most of the work day
column3: + Required to exert physical effort in handling objects less than _ pounds most of the work day
column4: + Required to be exposed to physical occupational risks (such as cuts, burns, exposure to toxic chemicals, etc.) often
column5: + Required to be exposed to physical environment which involves dirt, odors, noise, weather extremes or similar elements often
column6:
+ Normal setting for this job is: repair/maintenance shop.

Benefits

At Waste Management, each eligible employee receives a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. As well as a Stock Purchase Plan, Company Pension, and more! Our employees also receive Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal Days. Please note that benefits may vary by site.

If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been looking for, please click ""Apply.”
